Title: Chackai flyover to be opened in a week
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Finally, the national highway authority of India (NHAI) is gearing up to open the Chackai flyover as its construction, barring a few minor works, has been completed. Within a week, NHAI will partially open the flyover to facilitate traffic of vehicles from Kovalam to Kollam side.

As the construction of one slip road from the left side of the stretch from Kazhakoottam to Karode is yet to be completed, the NHAI will take some more time to open the other side for traffic. NHAI sources said the flyover will be fully opened after 10 days.

NHAI sources said the load tests conducted on the flyover last month were successful. The load tests were performed by placing fully-loaded trucks on the flyover to check its strength.

Though the NHAI is getting ready to open the flyover, the ongoing works of the Kerala Water Authority (KWA) to reconstruct the manhole at Enchakkal Junction is troubling the agency. Sources said it would take a minimum of 10 days for the work to be completed.

“Currently, Enchakkal Junction witnesses heavy traffic congestion. While the traffic chaos at Chackai will be resolved with the opening of flyover, it is going to worsen at Enchakkal. The ongoing works of the KWA will add more trouble,” NHAI sources said.

Meanwhile, the Kerala State Electricity Board (KSEB) has given a shocker to the NHAI by giving an estimate of Rs 1.75 crore for lighting the streetlights installed on the flyover. The KSEB had cited lack of feeder in nearby area as the reason for the exorbitant estimate. After the issue sparked a controversy, the KSEB conducted a joint inspection with the NHAI and is revising the estimate. A KSEB official said the new estimate, which will be much lesser than the earlier one, will be submitted within two days.

NHAI will power the streetlights using a generator till the issue with the KSEB is resolved.

NHAI sources said the state, which refused to share the flyover’s cost, has not given any respite in terms of powering the streetlights too. The NHAI was forced to construct the flyover at Chackai after the state government refused to raze down the approach to the airport.

The Chackai flyover consists of a two-lane bridge parallel to the existing railway over bridge. The 1050-metre-long flyover is constructed as a continuation of the ROB with around 42 spans. The width of the flyover is 19.6 metres, with two carriage ways of 9-metre width, a central median and crash barrier on either sides.

Title: Palarivattom flyover load test: RDS moves Kerala high court
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Kerala high court

KOCHI: RDS group, which was the contractor for Palarivattom flyover , has approached the Kerala high court to appoint an agency to conduct the load test at its expense.

The company alleged that the state government has not finalized an agency to conduct the load test, which is essential to conclude the instability of the flyover, even though two months has passed since the high court’s order on November 21t.

State attorney K V Sohan submitted before a division bench led by chief justice S Manikumar that the government has approached the Supreme Court against the order of November 21 and that the load test can be conducted within a week if the apex court’s decision is not in favour of the government. Based on the government’s submission, the court has postponed further hearing to February 5.

Title: Traffic curbs at Kazhakoottam Jn from Feb 1 for flyover work
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Tough days are ahead for motorists at Kazhakootam Junction with the works of elevated highway between Kazhakootam Junction and CSI Mission Hospital are set to commence soon. The collector on Wednesday announced that vehicular traffic along the junction will be regulated from February 1 onwards to facilitate the works and that the traffic regulations will continue till March 30.

As Kazhakootam is the intersection point of old NH-47 and NH-66, the regulations are sure to create huge congestions in the junction.

According to the statement issued by collector K Gopalakrishnan, vehicles going from Kollam to Thiruvananthapuram city direction will be diverted at AJ Hospital Junction and will be directed via Market Road to reach Kazhakootam Junction. From the junction, the vehicles can proceed either towards Sreekaryam or towards Technopark direction along the service road. Vehicles going from Sreekaryam to Kollam direction will also be directed via Market Road from Kazhakootam Junction along which they can enter the highway at AJ Hospital Junction.

“We will be conducting a trial run of these regulations during next week. Appropriate changes will be introduced after assessing the outcome,” said Kazhakootam Cyber City assistant commissioner R Anilkumar.

Title: Parkinson’s genetic research gets $2.3m Genetic research on Parkinson’s disease gets US grant
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: An Indo-German collaborative research proposal titled Genetic Architecture of Parkinson’s Disease in India, led by the comprehensive care centre for movement disorders in Sree Chitra Tirunal Institute for Medical Sciences and Technology (SCTIMST) and the Centre for Genetic Epidemiology, University of Tuebingen, Germany, has received a grant of $2.3 million from the Michel J Fox Foundation, USA.

The research was submitted by Dr Manu Sharma from the University of Tubingen, Germany, and Dr Asha Kishore, movement disorders specialist and director of SCTIMST. “This will be the first Genome-Wide Association Study (GWAS) on Parkinson’s disease (PD) in India and one of the largest GWAS conducted in the country,” said Dr Kishore.

GWAS in western population and east Asian regions have identified about 20 or more genetic variants as risk factors for Parkinson’s disease. As ethnically diverse populations vary in terms of the frequency of these variants in the population, it is necessary to conduct GWAS of Parkinson’s disease in India to capture the genetic variants that pose a risk for Parkinson’s disease among Indian patients under-represented in western studies, Dr Kishore added.

The aim of this research is to identify genetic risk factors of Parkinson’s disease in India through a GWAS. Approximately a half-million genetic markers will be assessed to identify the Indian Parkinson’s disease population-specific risk variants. To meet our objectives, more than 10,000 patients and 10,000 healthy controls will be recruited from across India to define a pan-Indian Parkinson’s disease map for the Indian population, she said.

A consortium of movement disorder specialists, neurologists and geneticists from 20 Indian centres are co-investigators in the multicentre international study along with the team in Germany led by Dr Sharma.

Title: Brain death: Kerala government Okays new guidelines
Content:
Pinarayi Vijayan

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: The state government recently approved new set of guidelines for declaring brain death of a patient.As per the new guidelines, the ventilator support of the patient can be removed by the medical team once the brain death is confirmed after tests without waiting for the consent from relatives.To declare a patient brain dead, a panel of doctors must perform prescribed tests twice with minimum interval of six hours. As per the new guidelines, medical practitioners should have a conversation with close relatives regarding the medical status and prognosis of the patient in whom brain stem death testing, including apnoea test, is being considered for confirmation of brain stem death diagnosis.The apnoea test should be the last brain stem reflex test to be performed and that too only if all other tests confirm the absence of other brain stem reflexes.All the prescribed tests are required to be performed twice to ensure that there has been no observer error and persistence of the clinical state can be documented with absolute degree of certainty. It is to be noted that the diagnosis is based on the clinical examination. After the completion of two consistent examinations by the medical experts panel, if criteria of brain stem death are met, the panel must declare the patient dead. “All treatments including cardiorespiratory support must be discontinued once brain stem death is pronounced,” says the new guidelines.Health minister pledges to donate organsTo promote organ donation, health minister K K Shailaja on Wednesday gave the consent for donating her organs after death. The minister was taking part in the international workshop on transplant administration organised by KNOS and government medical college, Thiruvananthapuram .

Title: Tamil Nadu: ‘Indirect polls for postponed local bodies on January 30’
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: The state government has informed the Madras high court that indirect for local bodies in places where election was postponed would be conducted on January 30. Following this, the court closed the petitions which sought to conduct indirect election.

G Singaraj of the DMK and a resident of Virudhunagar district , in his petition, stated that he was elected as ward 19 councillor of Rajapalayam panchayat union. He said that the indirect election for the post of chairman and vice-chairman which was scheduled on January 11 was postponed as the returning officer was hospitalised. Since the DMK had a majority of 15 ward members of the total 24 councillors, the election was postponed.

Hence, he moved the high court Madurai bench to conduct indirect election for Rajapalayam panchayat union.

Similarly, in another petition, K Nirmala, a resident of Virudhunagar district, and a member of the DMK, said she was elected as ward 2 councillor of Sattur panchayat union in the district. She stated that since the DMK had a majority with eight councillors and its alliance party MDMK had two councillors of the total 16 councillors, the indirect election was postponed following the riot started by the ruling party members. Hence, she moved the high court Madurai bench seeking to conduct indirect election for Sattur panchayat union. When these petitions were heard on Wednesday, the state made the submissions. Taking note of them, a division bench of justice M Duraiswamy and justice T Ravindran disposed of these petitions.

Title: 2 arrested for shooting dead Jalna trader
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representational Image

AURANGABAD: The local crime branch of Jalna police has nabbed two suspects with criminal record for allegedly shooting Jalna trader Rajesh Nahar dead on the night of January 11.

Nahar was found with two bullet injuries in his car on the Partur-Vatur road, near Dambri village, in Jalna.

Raghuveer Singh Chandu Singh Tak and Arvind alias Badu Arjun Bhadarge, both from Partur and residing in MIDC Waluj area, were on Wednesday remanded in police custody for nine days by a local court.

Jalna superintendent of police S Chaitanya called the arrest a major breakthrough and said: “We are trying to find out the motive for the businessman’s murder and the person behind it.”

According to police, Nahar, was involved in cases for allegedly hiring contract killers to eliminate his rivals and even business partners.

Inspector Rajendersingh Gaur of the LCB said, “Raghuveer has 14 offences and Badu several cases registered against them. Most of the cases against them are property offences in different parts of the state.”

Police sources said that Nahar had disputes running into several crores of rupees in the market and that he had been arrested in a case. A video clip depicting the trader with alleged contract killers was recovered from him, said the sources.

Citing content of the clip, police said that Nahar was seen paying Rs 5 lakh out of the contract money of Rs 50 lakh for eliminating a private money lender from Jalna, with whom he had a monetary dispute.

Title: Man booked for duping farmer of Rs 4.8 lakh
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Aurangabad: A 48-year-old man has been booked on charges of cheating and criminal breach of trust after he allegedly obtained a tractor on rent from a farmer and duped him of Rs 4.80 lakh.

According to police, the suspect is a special police officer (SPO) and he duped the farmer by claiming to be a retired police officer.

Former commissioner of police Yashasvi Yadav had introduced the concept of SPOs. The SPOs were given uniforms, whistle, baton and identity cards and were roped in with an aim to help city police with information and assistance in various tasks including maintenance of law and order situation.

Considering reports of some people with dubious track records making it to the list of SPOs, police had minimized taking their assistance, except in few cases.

As per complaint lodged by Ramesh Salve (50), a resident of Nagsennagar of Osmanpura, he met the 48-year-old suspect on January 23, 2019.

At the time of meeting, the suspect claimed to be an inspector who recently took voluntary retirement. The suspect sought the farmer’s tractor on rent.

Falling prey to the trap, the farmer handed over his tractor with registration number MH-20-AB-4116 against a rent of Rs 15, 000 per month. The complainant has stated that the suspect citing one or the other reason, not only failed to pay the promised rent on time for the past one year, but also failed to return the tractor.

Osmanpura police station inspector Dilip Tare said, “We have booked the suspect for cheating, criminal breach of trust, criminal intimidation and criminal conspiracy. Since the registration of offence, the suspect has gone underground and despite repeated attempts, he is untraceable.”

Title: Women can download Kavalan app and get 10% discount at this eatery
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: An eatery owner is giving 10% discount on the bill for women who download the Kavalan app, introduced by the Tamil Nadu state police. He approaches women customers to create sensitization on the app and even helps them download and install it on their mobile phones.

S M Rajaprabu, 24, from Pattukottai in Thanjavur started the Madurai Meenakshi Mess at Ponmeni in June 2019.

“Although I knew about the app, Iexplored it only then. Every woman should have the app on her mobile phone so that she can press the distress button in times of emergency. Many women are not aware of the app. That’s when I thought of sensitizing them,” he said. Rajaprabu came up with the idea of introducing 10% discount, when his friend’s sister needed help to download the app.

Rajaprabu has so far approached more than 500 women customers and helped 200 of them to install the app on their phones.

Rajaprabu has completed diploma in hotel management and worked as a manager in an eatery in Chennai for a few years. When he wanted to start an eatery targeting bachelors and offices to offer traditional food, he chose Madurai. Only South Indian food is offered for lunch with an array of non-veg dishes and tiffin items are offered for dinner.

“I wanted to give a home like feeling for my customers and that’s why we do not have even a menu card. ‘Murattu Single’ is our flagship combo, where 21 items including non-veg, seafood, savouries, starters are offered at an affordable price of Rs 299,” he said.

He also popularizes reading habit among his customers and delivery boys, and has kept a bunch of books, which they can browse through until the food arrives.

Title: Saying CAA won’t be rolled back is dictatorship: Nath salvo from Davos
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Bhopal: Discussing India’s economic growth at the World Economic Forum (WEF) in Davos on Wednesday, Madhya Pradesh chief minister Kamal Nath termed as “dictatorship” remarks by home minister Amit Shah that the new citizenship law won’t be rolled back at any cost, irrespective of the protests. The buzz around India is subdued at the WEF this time, Nath said.

“Public is supreme in democracy. It is the responsibility of the government to obey public opinion. If people are on the streets in protest against CAA, then you should reconsider this law, discuss it with everyone. But you say that this law will not be rolled back in any circumstances; then, it is just dictatorship,” Nath said in Davos in reaction to Shah’s vow at a rally in UP on Tuesday that CAA “won’t be rolled back at any cost, irrespective of the protests”.

Nath sees this as “autocracy”, and remarked that anti-CAA protests have hurt Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s image too. “The PM talks of cooperative federalism. But, states are not consulted before big decisions like CAA are rolled out. The youth of India are frustrated with PM Modi and this frustration will keep showing up in different ways. Nationwide CAA protests have hurt PM’s image,” the chief minister retweeted his statement after talking to reporters in Davos on Wednesday.

Nath, a regular at WEF for nearly 40 years, tweeted: “In all the decades that I have been coming to Davos for WEF, I have never seen the buzz around India so subdued. Everyone I meet is asking about the falling economy and growing social unrest. The central government is to blame for this mess.”

On January 13, Nath had questioned the need for the new citizenship law. “Is CAA necessary at a time when the country is facing an economic slowdown?” Nath had asked. “Is there a war going on? Are a large number of refugees seeking shelter in our country? CAA is only to divert the attention of public from crucial matters pertaining to economy, jobs and farm crisis. How long can BJP mislead people? There is an urgent need for improving our economic condition. PM Modi should talk about unemployment and farm crisis instead,” he had said.

Title: Kerala: Railway employee run over by train
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: A 42-year-old railway employee was run over by a train on Wednesday.

The accident took place near the coach factory attached to Kochuveli railway station near Karikkakom under Pettah police station limits.

Sajith S of SR Nivas, Mangalathu Nagarkavu, Chellamangalam, near Powdikonam is the deceased. He was a senior section engineer of the mechanical department at the wagon yard attached to Kochuveli railway station here.

According to police, the accident is suspected to have occurred around 6.30am.

Sajith was on night shift and his duty time ended at 6am. About 30 minutes later he was found dead on the track.

It is suspected that Sajith was knocked down and run over by Jan Shatabdi Express as he was crossing the track.

Eyewitnesses told police that Sajith was seen walking along the track while talking to someone over his mobile phone.

The police said that prima facie it appeared to be a case of accident. Meanwhile, chance of a suicide will also be probed as he may have jumped in front of the train after the call, they said.

The body of the deceased was handed over to the family after conducting postmortem. Sajith leaves behind wife Aswathy and a daughter.

Title: Delhi assembly elections: BJP campaign to focus on nationalism & Hindutva, explaining CAA to people
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Amit Shah, with MPs Meenakshi Lekhi and Manoj Tiwari, during a campaign in Lajpat Nagar earlier this month

NEW DELHI: With almost a fortnight to go before the February 8 elections for Delhi Assembly , BJP has planned a high-pitch campaign which will revolve around nationalism and Hindutva.

Senior party functionaries said that apart from talking about the “failures” of the Aam Aadmi Party government in Delhi, the campaigners will project the amended citizenship law, triple talaq, abrogation of Article 370 and 35A and the favourable ruling in the Ram temple case as achievements of the Narendra Modi-led central government in small group meetings across the city.

Complete Coverage on Delhi Elections

“Opposition parties have been misleading people on the issue of Citizenship Amendment Act and inciting violence. We need to clear the air and expose them,” said a senior party functionary. “We have conducted several public meetings and door-to-door campaigns informing people about the features of the act and how it is not about taking away the citizenship of anyone in the country.”

“While other parties ran away from big challenges such as abrogation of Article 370, making triple talaq a criminal offence and the issue of Ram temple, it is BJP which delivered on what it promised. People must know and remember while casting their votes,” he added.

The party has planned over 5,000 group meetings, with about 200-500 people each, which would be addressed by top party leaders. On Thursday, Union home minister Amit Shah will begin the campaign by addressing two such meetings and participating in a padyatra in Matiala, Uttam Nagar and Nagloi Jat assembly segments.

Addressing a booth workers’ convention on January 5, Shah had mentioned that the party’s focus in Delhi polls would be on smaller corner meetings though there were a few public rallies, to be addressed by PM Narendra Modi, BJP national president JP Nadda and himself, closer to the election date.

On Wednesday, the party released a list of 40 star campaigners, including Modi, Shah, Nadda, several Union ministers, chief ministers of BJP-served states, Bollywood stars Hema Malini and Sunny Deol and Bhojpuri actors Ravi Kishan and Nirahua.

Rajya Sabha member Vijay Goel said some party leaders have also been asked to go to slum clusters and unauthorised colonies, stay overnight and have a discussion around a “bonfire” over a “cup of tea”. “We will tell them how the AAP government has failed to deliver on various promises and blocked Aayushman Bharat and Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana. But we will also tell them how opposition parties are defining the CAA in an incorrect manner and even inciting violence on the issue,” he said.

There will be campaigning outside metro stations, discussions in the metro, outreach programmes targeting various communities and roadshows and public rallies in the last leg of electioneering.

The party prepared a roadmap for the next 15 days at a closed-door meeting late on Tuesday evening. It was attended by all top leaders. “The message that the party leadership conveyed to everyone is that BJP is winning this election and it should be visible in the party’s campaign. It should be intense and direct and focus on the target groups,” said Delhi BJP general secretary Kuljeet Chahal.

Title: BJP candidate Kapil Mishra terms Delhi polls contest between India, Pakistan
Content:
BJP's Model town candidate Kapil Mishra (ANI photo)

𝗜𝗻𝗱𝗶𝗮 𝘃𝘀 𝗣𝗮𝗸𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻 8𝘁𝗵 𝗙𝗲𝗯𝗿𝘂𝗮𝗿𝘆 𝗗𝗲𝗹𝗵𝗶 8 फरवरी को दिल्ली की सड़कों पर हिंदुस्तान और पाकिस्तान का मुकाबला होगा — Kapil Mishra (@KapilMishra_IND) 1579756568000

NEW DELHI: BJP ’s Model Town candidate Kapil Mishra on Thursday compared the Delhi assembly elections with the India-Pakistan dichotomy , drawing strong reactions from Congress and AAP .The row erupted when Mishra, in a tweet, likened the February 8 poll contest with a “muqabla” between India and Pakistan. The former AAP functionary then backed up his comments while speaking to reporters, stating that several “mini-Pakistans” had been created in Delhi and that Shaheen Bagh was being replicated all over the capital.“People have occupied the streets at Shaheen Bagh. They are not allowing children to go to schools and adults to offices. They have refused to follow the Constitution and Parliament. Videos are emerging of children talking about the death of PM Narendra Modi and home minister Amit Shah. The site has virtually turned into a mini-Pakistan. It is being backed by political parties,” Mishra said.He said such protests were causing a big inconvenience to the citizens.Mishra claimed that for political gains, parties were creating Shaheen Bagh-like protest centres. “In such a scenario, Hindustan will stand up against Pakistan and the assembly elections will be a contest between Hindustan and Pakistan,” Mishra said. “When other parties are openly supporting and creating mini-Pakistans, Hindustan cannot remain a silent spectator. The majority will not accept this...there will be a reaction to the action of the rioters who are against India,” he added.Mishra went on to call the women protesters anti-Indian. “Even those who attacked Parliament had tiranga on their cars. The youth of Jamia burned buses and were rioting. If BJP forms the government (in Delhi), we will arrest the tukde-tukde gang in 24 hours.”AAP’s Sanjay Singh dismissed the comments by asking “who is Kapil Mishra”. Congress functionary Mukesh Sharma said the BJP candidate’s remarks were an attempt to polarise opinion. “On February 8, people will decide whether they want jobs or unemployment. BJP is resorting to new tricks to divide people after CAA failed to do so. Its attempts towards polarisation will not work in Delhi.”Mishra, meanwhile, also targeted AAP over its development pitch. “We (BJP candidates) are explaining to the people in clear terms that Delhi did not witness any development in the last five years. No flyover was constructed, no new hospital or school was opened. Delhi is choking on pollution and the public transport system is in a shambles,” he said.

Title: Bata footwear showroom partially gutted in Karamana
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: A showroom of a prominent footwear brand, Bata, at Karamana was partially gutted in a fire that broke out in the three-storeyed building in which the showroom functioned.

The fumes were spotted when the manager of the showroom turned up in the morning to open the shop.

According to fire department officials, they received a call alerting them about the fire at 9.35am on Wednesday. The caller said that thick fumes were billowing out of the second floor of the building.

Three units of fire-fighters from the Thiruvananthapuram fire station rushed to the spot. The entire operation lasted just over 90 minutes. “Our priority after reaching the spot was to identify the source of the fire and then create a firebreak by removing combustible materials from the reach of the flames, thereby preventing it from spreading,” said Thiruvananthapuram fire station officer G Suresh Kumar. While one team of fire-fighters climbed to the second floor of the building to fight the fire, the others entered the other two floors and started removing all the goods inside. This strategy helped them keep the damages at minimum.

The fire broke out in the portion of the second floor of the building that was used as a storeroom. The shop authorities have not yet assessed the actual worth of the loss incurred. However, the fire department officials estimate that a loss of at least Rs 10 lakh has been incurred.

Officials said that the building did not have modern firefighting mechanisms . Though it is assumed that a short circuit may be the reason for the fire, the cause can be confirmed only after further examinations. tnn

Title: Pazhampori... back in IRCTC menu but at double the price
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Kochi: The railways has put appam, puttu, egg curry, pazhampori and several other favourite food items of Keralites back on its regional menu, but has also doubled the prices in the bargain.

‘Meals’ will now cost Rs 75, up from Rs 35, while a snack which came at a modest Rs 8 will now cost Rs 15.

On Tuesday, after an incensed social media vented its ire over the decision of Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) to drop several Kerala snacks and food items, the corporation has brought out a new menu which shows that they have been reinstated. As a bonus IRCTC has included an option of fish curry along with the meals.

“I welcome @IRCTCofficial decision to withdraw earlier decision to exclude Kerala delicacies from railway menu. It was the sentiment of Kerala that I echoed to chairman M P Mall. IRCTC officials visited me today and handed over the reinstated menu. We got fish curry meals as a bonus!,” tweeted Ernakulam MP Hibi Eden on Wednesday. Eden had taken up the issue by sending a letter to Union minister of railways Piyush Goyal and IRCTC chairman M P Mall.

Flaying the decision to drop items like appam & egg curry, porotta, puttu, pazhampori, elayada, Kozhukkata, unniyappam, neyyappam and sukhiyan from the railways menu, a handle by the name @Advaidism tweeted: “Malayalis don’t eat rajma chawal, chhole bhature, pav bhaji & khichdi. Even south Indians don’t eat it. First they came for our language, now they’re coming for our food. Cultural fascism at your door steps,” the tweet read.

IRCTC tweeted from its official handle on Tuesday that “in view of the demand from passengers and representations received, IRCTC has fully authorized it’s local offices in zones and regions to bring more items as per the local taste and regional preferences within one week as snack meals.” It also informed that all food items served earlier will be restored. “Some of these snacks were missing though they were in the menu since people who had the contract did not have people who knew how to make them. But I think this happened because IRCTC standardized the menu without giving much thought about attachment Keralites have towards these snacks,” said Krishnakumar P, secretary, Thrissur railway passengers association.

Eden said though they have revised the menu, IRCTC has not responded to the request to bring down the price. “They presented me with a revised menu on Wednesday morning and said an order reinstating the list of snacks that were excluded will be issued soon,” Eden said.

Title: Delhi assembly elections: RSS to throw its weight behind BJP campaign
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

The RSS workers plan to hold over 40,000 drawing room meetings before the February 8 polls

NEW DELHI: A fortnight before Delhi votes in the assembly election, an army of Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh workers has descended on the city. They plan to hold over 40,000 drawing room meetings before the February 8 polls and discuss subjects like Shaheen Bagh and Jamia protests , Citizenship Amendment Act , National Register of Citizens and Ram Mandir .

RSS expects each meeting to attract 15-20 people, who will be asked to stand with the “nationalist forces” in the “test of polarisation”. On the radar are youth, women, socially influential individuals, working class people and Dalits.

The campaigning for assembly polls has already entered the final phase. Having announced their candidates, Aam Aadmi Party, Congress and BJP leaders have hit the ground with roadshows, corner meetings, door-to-door campaigns and publicity blitz on social media.

The intervention of the RSS army in the all-consuming electioneering has immense significance for BJP. Unlike general elections, assembly polls are fought on local issues, but with Delhi the epicentre of the CAA-NRC protests, the citizenship issue has taken over political and public discourse in recent weeks. The sit-in at Shaheen Bagh, over a month-long now, is being widely discussed among the masses. BJP candidate from Model Town Kapil Mishra has been pushing for an end to the Shaheen Bagh protests , while other saffron leaders have castigated AAP and Congress for “backing” the agitators.

An RSS functionary maintained that Delhiites were against the protesters because the new law would grant citizenship to persecuted minorities in Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan. “Vested interests are supporting the CAA protests in Delhi. We are informing aware citizens that people are being inconvenience by other parties purely for vote-bank benefits,” the functionary said.

A 12-point pamphlet will be distributed to 25 lakh households in the capital. It talks about the abolition of triple talaq, construction of National War Memorial, development of Panchteerth in honour of BR Ambedkar, Ram Mandir in Ayodhya, CAA, 10% reservation in government jobs and educational institutions for the economically weaker sections and the regularisation of 1,731 illegal colonies in Delhi.

The pamphlet also offers the saffron view on the Jamia violence, the alleged hate speech by an MLA (the pamphlet does not name any political party or legislator), the delay in sanction of prosecution in the JNU sedition case, etc. “Vote thoughtfully to push forward the speed of development in Delhi and to stop the conspiring forces from breaking the nation,” the pamphlet urges. While asking for a 100% voters’ turnout, the paper asks people to keep in mind these issues when they reach the polling booths.

RSS has an extensive network of workers in almost all colonies of Delhi and they will be used for the awareness exercise. RSS Delhi unit spokesperson Rajeev Tuli, however, explained that the outreach workers will avoid discussing issues pertaining to the city because that is the job of BJP. The awareness exercise is likely to energise BJP’s campaign as the party attempts to dislodge AAP and return to power in Delhi after 27 years.

Title: Kolkata: Rs 500 notes, not Rs 2,000, are FICN gangs’ new favourites
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Counterfeit currency with a face value of Rs 3.6 lakh has been seized

KOLKATA: With the use and demand for currency of Rs 2,000 denomination coming down, those making fake notes have also shifted gears. The Special Task Force of Kolkata Police has busted a gang that makes counterfeit notes of Rs 500 denomination only.

“In one consignment, we found all the fake notes to be of Rs 500 denomination. In Kolkata, this is a first since demonetization,” said a senior investigating officer at Lalbazar.

The anti-FICN team of the Kolkata Police had a tio-off that some of the gang members would assemble near Shahid Minar at Esplanade. Accordingly, they laid a trap and caught two from the gang around 6pm on January 21. On search, the cops seized 692 fake notes, with a face value of Rs 3.6 lakh from the two. The accused have been identified as Senaul Sk alias Sanaul (34) and Akramul (43), both residents of Kaliachak in Malda. “One of the accused had got a secret pocket stitched to his sweater to carry the counterfeit currency. He was planning to distribute these fake notes in trading hubs in the state,” said an IPS officer. Like earlier, these notes, too, carried Bangladeshi watermarks.

“With the RBI regulating the flow of Rs 2,000 in the market, the counterfeiters have gone back to making fake Rs 500 notes, their forte before demonetization,” claimed a senior officer.

Title: Odisha looks to spread wings with more national, international flights
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

BHUBANESWAR: Buoyed by a strong passenger sentiment and increasing flight movements, Odisha is eyeing newer destinations. On Wednesday, chief minister Naveen Patnaik chaired a meeting with chief executives of different airlines and officers of state government and civil aviation ministry during which a plan was unveiled to operate 14 flights to about five international destinations and three new places on the domestic map.

Abu Dhabi, Singapore, Bangkok, Sri Lanka and Dubai are the international destinations that the state has set its eyes on. On the home front, Kolkata-Jharsuguda, Bhubaneswar-Varanasi, Jharsuguda-Mumbai, Prayagraj-Bhubaneswar, Bhubaneswar-Rourkela and Bhubaneswar-Kalaikunda are the new destinations being planned.

At present, only the flight to Malaysian capital Kuala Lumpur is operational from the Biju Patnaik International Airport in Bhubaneswar. The one to Bangkok has been suspended for now. At the domestic level, flights from Bhubaneswar airport reach Delhi, Kolkata, Bengaluru, Hyderabad, Chennai, Guwahati, Mumbai and Surat.

The city airport has witnessed 38 lakh passengers by the end of 2018-19 fiscal, 8 lakh more than the previous financial year. Besides, the number of aircraft movements has gone up from 58,000 in 2017-18 to 63,000 in 2018-19.

Talking about the Odisha growth story, Naveen urged the Centre and the airlines to improve air connectivity from Odisha to domestic and international destinations.

“I take this opportunity to thank the ministry of civil aviation for increased connectivity to Odisha. I further request the ministry to introduce new connectivity from Odisha to domestic destinations like Pune, Jaipur, Lucknow, Chennai, Vizag, Kochi and Ranchi. Similar is the demand for potential international hubs like Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Singapore, Hong Kong, Bangkok and Colombo. I assure that the state government will provide necessary support,” Naveen said at the meeting.

The government has said it will offer 1 per cent VAT on air turbine fuel for international flights . “In the last few years, the aviation traffic in Odisha has witnessed a vertical ride. Though domestic flight connectivity has seen noticeable improvement, there is greater scope for international connectivity,” Naveen said highlighting the fact that a sizeable number of techno-savvy Odias is active in countries like the USA and Australia besides European and South-east Asian countries.

Besides, a substantial Odia population is also working in the Gulf countries. “I strongly believe that our ‘skilled in Odisha’ module has strengthened Brand Odisha, making our professionals high in demand in many countries across the globe,” Naveen added.

Chief secretary Asit Tripathy, civil aviation secretary P S Kharola, transport minister Padmanav Behera, civil aviation joint secretary Usha Padhi, transport secretary Pramod Meherda and industry secretary Vishal Dev were present at the meeting, which was attended by 25 CEOs of different airlines. Representatives from AirAsia, Etihad, SilkAir, IndiGo and SpiceJet were among those who attended the meeting.

Title: More calls for Big Temple consecration to be in Tamil
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

VV Swaminathan (third from left) demanded the state government erect the statue of King Raja Raja Cholan on Ch... Read More

TRICHY: Former state minister for Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowment (HR&CE), V V Swaminathan, on Wednesday, said that it would be a betrayal of Tamil if the proposed consecration at Big Temple is not conducted in the language.

Addressing a conference in Thanjavur , Swaminathan urged the state government to conduct the consecration ceremony at Big Temple in Tamil, which is scheduled to be held on February 5.

“Consecration must be performed only in Tamil language. It is shameful and a betrayal of Tamil if the state government fails to take necessary steps to conduct the ceremony in Tamil,” he added.

Swaminathan also demanded that the state government establish the statue of King Raja Raja Cholan on Chennai’s Marina beach. The whereabouts of the king's tomb is also a mystery, he said and added that the government should do the needful to find an answer to the question.

While talking about the stolen statues of King Raja Raja Cholan and his wife Logamadevi, Swaminathan said though the statues were brought back by the idol wing police to India, they are yet to be reinstalled at the temple. There was a connection between the staff of the temple and the thieves who stole the idols earlier, he alleged.

Various resolutions have been adopted at the conference including pressurizing the government with regard to consecration in Tamil. Another resolution urged the government to take over the control of the temple from the trustee of Thanjavur Palace Devasthanam and senior prince Babaji Rajah Bhonsle.

Earlier in the morning, puja was conducted at a marriage hall in Thanjavur by Hindu Vedha Marumalarchi Iyakkam headed by its president T Ponnuswami , in which Kudanthai Irai Neri Imayavan, Thanjai Periya Kovil Urimai Meetpukuzhu president C Murugesan and its organizer P Maniarasan participated.

Title: Delhi assembly elections: Parties tap into doubts over drinking water to quench their thirst for votes
Content:
Aam Aadmi Party has promised 24-hours availability of tapped drinking water in all houses

NEW DELHI: At a JJ cluster in south Delhi’s Kalkaji Extension, Adhir Chand Rai surveyed the dismal sprawl of Bhoomiheen Camp and sighed, “Before every election, I have heard many promises being made.”One thing, however, has impressed the 79-year-old. “The water situation has improved in the last two years. Supply lines that terminated at DDA flats have been extended to our homes,” he said. What is more, with their limited consumption, the hutment dwellers invariably end up paying nothing for water.In the 2013 assembly elections campaign, the newly started Aam Aadmi Party had promised bijli half, paani maaf — halved power bills and free water up to 20,000 litres a month. The scheme came into force on January 1, 2014, and data for the last billing cycle (November — December 2019) proved that 60% of Delhi’s households received zero bills for water.In a water-stressed city with a demand-supply gap of around 300 million gallons a day, political parties seek to turn water into votes. If AAP is tom-tomming its free water scheme and the expansion of water-supply infrastructure in unauthorised colonies and JJ clusters, no less than PM Narendra Modi described water quality as the capital’s biggest problem at an election rally at Ramlila Maidan last month, citing the increasing sale of water purifiers to support his argument.Delhi Jal Board vice-chairman Dinesh Mohaniya, for his part, quickly disproved a BIS survey showing poor results for some tap water samples from the city with its own tests that returned conclusions showing 98.2% of the 4,204 samples assessed had passed the quality benchmarks. He insisted that water being supplied in Delhi more than adequately met World Health Organization norms of 5% sample failure rate. The entire water purifier industry was founded on spreading doubts about water quality, he alleged.The reality perhaps lies somewhere between these two extremes. As Jasbir Chadda of URJA, a collective of city RWAs, observed, while supply network had reached unauthorised colonies, the distribution pipelines in planned areas were 40-50 years old. “AAP needs to focus on distribution of normal quality water 24x7. Water is a matter of trust. People must be confident of DJB’s capability to supply water drinkable straight from the tap.”Yogender Pandit, a security guard who lives in Surat Vihar near Bhalswa lake, says that water lines were laid in his area around a decade back, but water quality deteriorated after a coupleof years. “We get brackish water that can’t be used for drinking. That is why there are many water plants in Burari,” said Pandit.DJB has undertaken unprecedented infrastructure expansion in the past five years and piped water coverage has gone up from 54% to 89% of the households. Supply lines have been taken to 618 new colonies, sewer lines to 154. Water production has increased 14% and sewage treatment 21%. The addition of over six lakh active meters has boosted DJB’s revenue from Rs 1,219 crore in 2014-15 to Rs 1,819 crore in 2019, though the capital intensive infra development put the books under pressure.“When you can’t check losses, how will you replace broken pipelines?” asked Manoj Tiwari, the BJP’s Delhi president, citing figures from the answers to an RTI query. In its 2018 response, DJB had put its deficit for 2018-19 at Rs 663.6 crore. In 2008-09, the water utility had logged a surplus of Rs 61.9 crore, which increased to Rs 227.8 crore the following year. Mohaniya explained the losses as primarily due to infrastructure expansions and a higher salary burden after the implementation of the 7th Pay Commission recommendations.DJB also came up with plans to augment water resources, with the focus being on developing and conserving water bodies. Besides launching the Palla riverbed water storage project, the revival of 201 waterbodies has been announced, 155 to be undertaken by DJB. Pilot projects at Rajokri Lake and Gogha drain proved successful. However, cleaning the Yamuna from Wazirabad drain onward remains a work in progress.Jyoti Sharma, founder and head of FORCE, an organisation involved with water and sanitation issues, expressed happiness at Delhi moving in the right direction with improved access to drinking water and innovative approaches to water conservation. “The focus now should be on end-user water quality and water-use efficiency,” she said.Ahead of the February 8 polls, Aam Aadmi Party has promised 24-hours availability of tapped drinking water in all houses, while Congress has assured of not only the continuation of the 20,000 litre scheme but also an additional 30 paise cashback on each litre of water saved by a household. BJP is leveraging the Centre’s National Drinking Water Mission to woo votes with the promise of piped water to Delhi homes.

Title: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat in Gorakhpur from January 24
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat. (PTI file photo)

GORAKHPUR: RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat will reportedly be in Gorakhpur from January 24 to January 27 for flag hoisting ceremony on Republic Day at Saraswati Shishu Mandir Senior Secondary School, Bilandpur Khatta. RSS members will also be present on the occasion.

He will hold the annual meeting of east UP in which all pracharak and members of Goraksh, Kanpur, Kashi and Awadh prant will participate and VHP, Vidyarthi parishad, Sanskar Bharti like organizations are also invited in the meeting. Mohan Bhagwat is visiting Gorakhpur after three years.

Title: Tamil Nadu: Schools struggle to verify community documents of students
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

TRICHY: While school education department has instructed state board schools to verify community certificates of Class V and VIII students who will be appearing for board examination this year, some of the schools are unable to verify the details .

With Saturday fixed as the last date to update the details by the teachers in Education Management Information System (EMIS), a centralized database of students, many of the parents have still not obtained a community certificate for their children who are in class V.

“Mostly students belonging to scheduled caste community obtain the certificate at an early stage as they are entitled to scholarship. However, students from backward class community will only furnish the community certificate when they come to Class X. Though the students give the details of their community, it is verified before preparing a nominal role,” said a government school headmaster from Trichy. As students of Class V and VIII will be appearing for state board examination from this year, teachers have been asked to update the details before Saturday to update details of students in EMIS.

Tamil Nadu Aasiryar Munnetra Sangam, K Uduman Ali said that parents could have been given some more time to get the community certificate. Many of the parents have applied for a community certificate and it is highly unlikely to get it before Saturday.

A block education officer from Trichy district said that it isn’t mandatory for all the parents to furnish the community certificate as details of their wards had been already fed in EMIS at the time of their admission. Their credentials will be used in board examination certificates. Since it will be used for further communication, parents are asked to verify the details, said the official.

Title: Aurangabad: Valuer held for passing metals as gold to get loan
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Illustration used for representational purpose

AURANGABAD: The crime branch of the city police, while searching for a chain-snatcher, ended up detecting another case involving a gold valuer who allegedly passed other metals as gold for obtaining loan against them.

Police have arrested Sharad Jagannath Shahane (35), the gold valuer, and his younger brother Sachin (32) — both residents of Balaji Nagar.

Crime branch inspector Madhukar Sawant said, “We were looking for Satish Baburao Naik (27), who already has a record of being involved in chain-snatching cases. After tracking him down, he revealed that one of his friends has obtained two gold loans on his name by submitting gold-plated ornaments.”

Upon cross-verifying the claims made by Naik, the crime branch team went to Jana Small Finance Bank in Garkheda. The bank roped in another gold valuer who carried out the valuation of the metals deposited and found that duplicate gold ornaments were deposited in the bank for obtaining loan.

However, as the bank was taking longer than usual to take a call about lodging a complaint, Naik lodged a complaint with Jawaharnagar police following which the accused were booked on charges of cheating and criminal breach of trust.

As per complaint lodged by Naik, few months ago one of his friends contacted him with a request to help him obtain loan against gold. Naik, who was reluctant in opening the gold loan account in his name, somehow agreed after his friend claimed that he did not have the required documents. The suspect even offered to give a portion of money to Naik from the money obtained from the bank.

Accordingly, the suspect brought some gold-plated ornaments and on October 25, 2019 reached out to the bank, where his friend’s elder brother worked as gold valuer. The metal was passed off as gold and against it they obtained loan of Rs 1 lakh.

Days later, the suspect contacted him again and obtained another loan of Rs 2 lakh. On both occasions, the suspect did not give Naik the money promised from the loan amount.

Crime branch inspector said preliminary probe revealed that the suspect provides his services as valuer to several banks in the city and using similar modus operandi, he is suspected of obtaining loans from different banks.

Title: TN: Accused in killing of man, son murdered
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

TRICHY: A 50-year-old man, who was the prime accused in the double murder of a man and his son, was hacked to death by a six-member gang near Keeranur in Pudukottai district on Wednesday morning.

The murdered man has been identified as A Murthy, a former panchayat union councillor. Murthy, who was on his morning walk, was hacked to death by six men who came on three motorcycles.

Police said Murthy was the prime accused in the murders of Veerasamy of Kalamavur and his son, Muthu, over a property dispute.

Police said that Veerasamy and Muthu had struck a deal for Rs 1.25 crore to purchase a farmhouse owned by Murthy last year. According to police, Murthy had received the money but refused to vacant the farmhouse. Due to this, the dispute aggravated, and Murthy decided to eliminate the father-son duo.

A 12-member gang, hired by Murthy, hacked the father and the son to death in February last year. Further, the attack also left Veerasamy’s relatives Jeyaraman and his son Sivasangu, with brutal injuries.

Police had arrested 18 people, including Murthy in connection with the murders. While he managed to get bail a few months back, he was maintaining a low profile at his home in Keeranur.

Police said Murthy could have been murdered to avenge the murders of the father-son duo.

Pudukottai district superintendent of police Arun Sakthi Kumar constituted four teams to nab the gang.

Title: Trichy: Man booked for kidnapping minor girl
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

TRICHY: A 29-year-old man has been booked for kidnapping a minor girl in Manapparai in Trichy on Tuesday.

According to police , the 17-year-old victim, a class XI dropout was working in a private company in Thuvarankurichi area. On Monday, she went to her workplace as usual but she did not return home till late at night. Her parents searched for her but it went in vain.

However, the parents raised suspicion on Baranikumar, 29 of Seegampatti village near Thuvarankurichi as he wanted to marry the girl and asked them to arrange for the marriage. Citing her minor age, the parents had turned down his proposal and asked him to wait until the girl turned major. Suspecting that Baranikumar could have kidnapped their daughter, they lodged a complaint with the Thuvarankurichi police on Tuesday. Based on the complaint, the police registered a case against him. The police said that the minor girl was yet to be rescued.

Title: Pakistan has little credibility on J&K: US report
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

File image used for representation.

NEW DELHI: Pakistan has “limited options” to respond to India’s decision to abrogate Article 370 on Jammu & Kashmir and can only hope to gain from “self-inflicted” damage caused by New Delhi’s policies in Kashmir and on the citizenship law, US Congress’s research arm, the Congressional Research Service , has said.

“Given also that Pakistan and its primary ally, China, enjoy limited international credibility on human rights issues, Islamabad may stand by and hope that self-inflicted damage caused by New Delhi's own policies in Kashmir and, more recently, on citizenship laws, will harm India’s reputation and perhaps undercut its recent diplomatic gains with Arab states such as Saudi Arabia and the UAE,” the CRS said.

In a new report, the CRS said Pakistan’s diplomatic isolation as well as its “reduced” capability to alter the status quo in J&K through military means limited its options.

“Many analysts view Islamabad as having little credibility on Kashmir, given its long history of covertly supporting militant groups there. Pakistan’s leadership has limited options to respond to India’s actions, and renewed Pakistani support for Kashmiri militancy likely would be costly internationally. Pakistan’s ability to alter the status quo through military action has been reduced in recent years, meaning that Islamabad likely must rely primarily on diplomacy,” the CRS said, noting that Pakistan appeared diplomatically isolated on the Kashmir issue and had only Turkey as its explicit ally.

The CRS said following India’s August 2019 actions, numerous members of the US Congress went on record in support of Kashmiri human rights. A House resolution introduced in December and currently with 40 co-sponsors, urged the Indian government to end the restrictions on communications in J&K, it said.

“Yet, any US impulse to tilt toward India is to some extent offset by Islamabad's current, and by most accounts vital, role in facilitating Afghan reconciliation negotiations. President Donald Trump's apparent bonhomie with Pakistan's prime minister and offer to mediate on Kashmir in July was taken by some as a new and potentially unwise strategic shift,” it said.

Pakistan has been working hard to bring diplomatic pressure on India, including though China. China has called for a special discussion on Kashmir three times in the past six months. On August 16, the UNSC met for the first time in decades to discuss Kashmir.

Title: Ranchi congestion forced flight diversion: Airline
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Kolkata: A day after an AirAsia India flight (I5-545) from Delhi to Ranchi had made a fuel SOS diversion to Kolkata, the airline claimed that the captain’s decision was forced by a congestion .

The airport operator, however, denied the airline's claim, saying the exigency had possibly occurred because the flight was carrying less fuel. The flight departed with requisite fuel and an additional padding. On reaching Ranchi, there was a congestion and the landing was kept on hold. By the time the aircraft could make an approach, the additional fuel reduced to a great extent and the crew had to divert it to Kolkata as per the policy laid down by the company. The aircraft landed in the city and after refuelling, it returned to Ranchi. We reiterate that we gave importance to safety and security in all aspects of operations and apologise for the inconvenience caused to passengers,” said an airline spokesperson.

Ranchi airport director, Vinod Kumar Sharma, said it was not unusual for planes to queue up for landing and carry holding fuel. “A queue of planes arriving to land is routine. The diversion took place because the pilot felt he was running on low fuel ,” said Sharma. Officials at Ranchi airport said this was not the first time that flights to the airport had been diverted to Kolkata. This has made it to the headline simply because the pilot declared the plane was low on fuel. “The diversion happens because planes do not carry enough holding fuel to wait in queue,” said an official at Ranchi ATC, adding that the practice was fuelled by the incentive to purchase aviation turbine fuel at Ranchi, where the price was substantially lower than other airports.

“Picking up fuel from Ranchi leads to substantial saving in operational costs. But at times, it poses a safety risk,” said another official.

An ATC official said the flight would have touched down 18 minutes after it chose to go to Kolkata. “The Air India flight had already been cleared to land ahead of the AirAsia aircraft . It would have touched down in 9 minutes and the AirAsia flight, further 9 minutes later,” he said. In fact, on Tuesday, there were two more planes behind AirAsia and they landed in Ranchi without the need for a refuelling stop elsewhere.

Title: CCP yet to release seized food carts
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Panaji: Fourteen food carts selling ros omlette and Chinese food in the paved area near Don Bosco School in Panaji seized for dumping waste directly in the drains, are yet to be released by the Corporation of the City of Panaji (CCP), and are not likely to be allowed to operate there again, Panaji mayor Uday Madkaikar said at a CCP meeting last week.

“The food carts continue to remain confiscated by us. We need to rethink their location and decide how many can be relocated. They will be released on payment of a fine,” CCP commissioner Sanjit Rodrigues told TOI.

The carts operated throughout the night,cooking at site but not cleaning up after. The corporation found chicken bones and food waste dumped in the drains, emanating a stench. The mayor has threatened to cancel their licenses, reasoning that people’s health was at stake. “The operators were carrying out their business by inconveniencing others,” Madkaikar said, attributing the flooding in the area to the cart operators clogging the drains.

The issue was raised at the CCP meeting last week by corporator Soraya Pinto Makhija, who suggested the carts be relocated to Patto plaza, where offices shut by 6.30pm and there is ample parking. At the meeting, Madkaikar said the food carts would not be moved back there and that a meeting of the town vending committee would be called to discuss the matter.

The corporation has received several complaints from the school and residents of the neighbourhood.

Title: Keep supporting BJP or Congress, but vote for broom: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal
Content:
CM Arvind Kejriwal waved to the crowd on the streets of Swaroop Nagar as the first of his second round of road... Read More

NEW DELHI: “Humne badi mushkil se schools, hospitals acche kiye hain... Aap logon ne agar kisi aur party ko vote diya toh ye sab kharab ho jayega. Aap BJP ke ho toh BJP mein rehna, Congress ke ho toh Congress mein rehna, par iss baar vote jhaadoo ko dena (we have worked hard to improve the condition of hospitals and schools. If you vote for some other party, all the effort will go waste. Whether you support BJP or Congress, vote for the broom this time).”Taking pains to differentiate between assembly and Lok Sabha polls , chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday reiterated his party’s development pitch for seeking votes. Sitting on a chair affixed on a jeep, the CM waved to the crowd on the streets of Bhalswa Dairy and Swaroop Nagar as the first of his second round of roadshows kicked off.Donning a cap with the party’s name and symbol, Kejriwal sported a red sweater and his trademark muffler as he lent his voice to the campaigns of AAP candidates for Badli and Adarsh Nagar, Ajesh Yadav and Pawan Sharma, respectively.Though the CM rarely got down from the jeep during the nearly two-hour roadshow, he readily accepted colourful turbans and stoles offered by the villagers and put them on. He also shook hands with a few senior citizens. Amid tight security, the roadshow began from Som Bazar Road in Swaroop Nagar. Party supporters sang AAP’s election campaign song, Lage raho Kejriwal, and distributed pamphlets to the residents.As the cavalcade chugged towards Bhalswa Dairy Road, its speed automatically slowed due to uneven roads, overflowing drains and silt or garbage lying at various places. A resident claimed that a part of the silt was removed only the previous night in anticipation of the rally.“The roads haven’t been carpeted for years and it’s nearly impossible to walk here after it rains. But at least AAP has provided relief to us poor people in form of water and electricity bill waivers. Also, our children are getting better education,” she said.Jai Prakash, an auto driver, opined that Devender Yadav of Congress was a strong candidate and could give AAP’s Ajesh Yadav a run for his money. At the same time, he said AAP government’s schemes for the poor and the CM’s “low profile” were undeniable factors. “He (Kejriwal) was the one who continuously fought for a legal tag for the unauthorised colonies. BJP has done nothing even as mountains of garbage have piled up,” he claimed.At Durga Chowk, the procession took a 10-minute break. Pointing to the broken roads, the CM said: “These roads will be carpeted soon... I have ordered that the work be completed in 3-4 months. If I promise something, it means it will be fulfilled. The work done by us in the past five years is the proof of that,” Kejriwal said.“I have worked for the welfare of my people like any elder son of a family would. The party has made all possible efforts to take Delhi forward in the last five years, providing free electricity and water, improving the infrastructure in schools and hospitals and developing roads. But all the work that has been pending for 70 years cannot be completed in just five years. So, I urge you not to let anything obstruct the development of Delhi,” he said.In a similar vein, the CM tweeted: “I appeal to the supporters of BJP, Congress and other parties — these elections are different, all of them, vote for the broom (sic).”Kejriwal also took a jibe at the Centre for inflation, saying it has became difficult for a common man to run his household. “I feel good that in such a situation, we are able to provide some relief to the common man,” he saidLater in the day, as Kejriwal took out another roadshow from Krishna Nagar, a group of youths showed him black flags. They claimed to be locals and said they were unhappy with the functioning of the local MLA.

Title: Tamil Nadu: Boy missing, four rescued as waves lash Velankanni
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

NAGAPATTINAM: A 12-year-old boy has gone missing while four of his relatives had a miraculous escape as a giant wave washed them away in the Bay of Bengal on Velankanni beach on Tuesday evening while they were taking bath. Coast Guard personnel and marine police have intensified search operations for the boy.

According to marine police, Ravikumar, 40, from Bengaluru had arrived at the shrine on Tuesday morning along with his son R Vighil, 12, and relatives including Priya, 35, Mohana, 11, Pooja, 24, and Sopna, 35. In the evening, Pooja, Sopna, Priya, Mohana and Vighil were taking bath in the sea when the wave swept all of them.

Relatives and onlookers raised an alarm and informed marine police as well as fishermen. They arrived at the spot and managed to rescue the four of them but not the boy who is still missing. All the four were sent to the government hospital in Nagapattinam .

Title: Submit report on waste handling, NGT tells Greater Chennai corporation
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

NGT

CHENNAI: Construction of a compost yard, which was stopped following opposition from locals in Poothapedu near Valasaravakkam , may not resume anytime soon.

The National Green Tribunal ( NGT ), Southern Zone, has directed the Greater Chennai Corporation to submit a report on how it handles waste at present before taking a call in the issue. The civic body had planned to build a compost yard on School Street in Poothapedu to dispose biodegradable waste. However, local residents, particularly those living in nearby apartments, opposed it saying they were using the land as a park and if the corporation dumps waste in an unhygienic manner, it would affect the surroundings causing health hazards. No proper site inspection was conducted before identifying the area, surrounded by schools and religious places, for this purpose and it’s in violation of the Municipal Waste Management Rules, residents alleged.

So, they approached the NGT seeking directions to remove construction carried out so far and permanently stop further efforts to commence operation of a compost yard or any other waste processing facility at Poothapedu.

The corporation, in response, argued that work at Poothapedu was stopped in 2018 following opposition from the locals. But the facility, aimed at decomposing organic waste using aerobic method and later converting it to manure in public interest, won’t cause any pollution or have any detrimental effect on the environment.

Tamil Nadu Pollution Control Board (TNPCB) inspected the place and confirmed that no construction happened there after 2018. However, TNPCB pointed out that the corporation hasn’t filed any application for obtaining its consent to operate such a facility as mandated by local laws.

Counsel for the government argued that the case was also heard by the Madras high court. There was nothing wrong is using a portion of the park for establishing a compost yard, the court ruled. Local authorities were told to ensure that no nuisance was caused to residents and the facility premises was cleaned twice a day to avoid mosquitoes.

On hearing the case, NGT members Justice K Ramakrishnan and Saibal Dasgupta directed the corporation to submit a report on present waste management strategies and whether legacy waste was dumped in that area. The matter will be heard again on February 17.

Title: Artha Tatwa group chief Pradeep Sethy attempts suicide in Jharpada jail
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

BHUBANESWAR: Chief managing director of Artha Tatwa (AT) Group Pradeep Sethy allegedly attempted suicide in Jharpada special jail here on Tuesday.

Jail superintendent (Jharpada) Subhakant Mishra said, “Sethy tried to strangulate himself by using an electrical wire inside the jail toilet on Tuesday afternoon.” The prison’s directorate has started an investigation into the case.

The news of Sethy’s second suicide bid surfaced only after he was shifted to SCB Medical College and Hospital in Cuttack on Wednesday. Sethy had made the first attempt in 2016, blaming poor medical facilities and sluggish trial of his cases.

The AT Group chief is serving a seven-year jail term for his involvement in two separate cheating cases and still faces trial in connection with a few more cases.

The jail authorities blamed Sethy’s alleged mental condition for such an attempt. Mishra said, “Sethy has been undergoing treatment for a mental health condition over the past few years. On Tuesday, he had an altercation with a clerk inside the jail. Once it was over, Sethy snapped a wire from the inverter in the welfare section and ran with it to the toilet. Though security personnel chased him, he locked himself in.”

Mishra added, “The jail guards broke open the door of the toilet and rescued Sethy. He was found strangulating himself with the help of the wire.” Mishra further said Sethy did not have any injury mark on his body and was referred to the psychiatric ward (mental health institute) at SCB.

The jail authorities informed that Sethy had a few violent episodes in the last few months and was kept under vigil. He was lodged in cell no. 6 along with other undertrial prisoners.

The SCB doctors said they were examining Sethy’s mental health. “We will conduct certain tests on him. His condition is stable now,” a doctor said.

AT Group has been accused of duping investors of more than Rs 500 crore in the state. Police said Sethy completed his PhD in Botany from Karnataka University and pursued higher studies in Malaysia. Sethy transformed his company to a Rs 350-crore business empire between 2009 and 2012, they added.

He then floated nine other sister concerns and diversified his business into real estate, shares and investment and restaurant, among others. Sethy was arrested by Kharavel Nagar police here in May 2013.

Title: Govt replaces Abhijit Bangar with Tukaram Mundhe as Nagpur municipal commissioner
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Tukaram Mundhe

NAGPUR: The state government on Tuesday replaced Abhijit Bangar with Tukaram Mundhe as the municipal commissioner.

Bangar’s transfer comes as a surprise because he completed only 14 months in office despite having a minimum tenure of 36 months.

Additional chief secretary (GAD) Sitaram Kunte issued a letter to Mundhe, directing him to hand over his existing charge of project director, Maharashtra State AIDS Control Society, Pune, to another officer and take charge as municipal commissioner of the NMC with immediate effect.

Surprisingly, the government did not issue any letter to Bangar regarding his new posting.

The government has upgraded the post of municipal commissioner as Mundhe is an IAS officer of 2005 batch while Bangar belongs to the 2008 batch. Bangar assumed charge at NMC on November 14, 2018.

Mundhe has been transferred thirteen times in his 15-year career. He was transferred from Nashik Municipal Corporation in November 2018 after the general body passed a no confidence motion against him.

Mayor Sandip Joshi said Bangar did a commendable job with the highlight being improving the rank of the city in Swachh Survekshan. “I hope the NMC administration will improve its speed and efficiency under Mundhe. Everybody will have to ensure further development of the city and provide basic amenities to citizens,” he said.

Rumours of Bangar’s replacement with Mundhe started with Maha Vikas Aghadi forming the government in the state. Talk of the Sena-Congress-NCP-led government planning to take control of the BJP-led NMC by appointing Mundhe as the civic chief was doing the rounds.

Bangar tackled major issues like the worst-ever water crisis, appointment of new garbage operators, improvement of the city bus service, speeding up of the Smart City project, rejection of the proposed road from Bharat Van, acquisition of land for Metro Rail , cement roads and control over avoidable expense by curtailing the budget by 25%.

Title: Goa: CCP contract staff not paid salaries for December
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Former mayor Surendra Furtado warned that non-payment of salaries could affect the functioning of the civic bo... Read More

PANAJI: Sixteen contract staff, including junior civil and IT engineers, assistant accountants and lower divisional clerks working for the Corporation of the City of Panaji(CCP) are yet to receive their salaries for the month of December.

In December , staff salaries are usually released in advance. The employee contracts of the staff working in the technical, accounts, IT, administration and solid waste sections expired in October.

Mayor Uday Madkaikar said a decision is taken every six months at the standing committee meeting to renew the contracts. At the last standing committee meeting, the decision was not taken, he said, adding that this would be done at the next meeting, following which salaries will be released.

“We will review the performances of the contract staff and decide whether to renew their contracts or not," he told TOI.

Former mayor Surendra Furtado raised the issue of non-payment of salaries for the month of December at the corporation meeting held last week, saying the non-release of salaries could affect the functioning of the civic body.

On the other hand, corporator Ruth Furtado raised the issue of CCP hiring staff without the mandatory approval of the director of municipal administration, (DMA) and without advertising the posts.

Sources say the salaries of the contract workers haven’t been released as the accounts department refused to release the salaries of the new staff, as they were appointed without any advertisement.

CCP commissioner Sanjit Rodrigues attributed the delay in the release of salaries to administrative issues. “The renewal is pending with the government administration. There is nothing stopping the payment of salaries,” he told TOI.

Title: Odisha: STF on hunt for gangs making fake Aadhaar cards
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

BHUBANESWAR: The special task force (STF) of the crime branch has started a probe into the operations of interstate gangs that make fake Aadhaar cards. The probe began after the STF rescued six sex workers suspected to be from Bangladesh here on Tuesday and found them possessed of fake Aadhaar cards.

“The addresses mentioned on the cards were in Kolkata. We have requested Kolkata Police and Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) to ascertain the authenticity of the cards seized from the six women. Our larger goal is to dismantle the networks that create fake Aadhaar cards,” STF’s deputy inspector-general Jay Narayan Pankaj told TOI.

Sources in the STF said the six women, all in their twenties and thirties, had admitted to the probe agency that they had been trafficked from Bangladesh and engaged in prostitution in Bhubaneswar. They were rescued from Old Town area on Tuesday, hours after the STF arrested a couple from Pipili in Puri district for allegedly forcing them into sex trade.

The STF is also planning to seek the assistance of the ministry of home affairs (MHA) to prevent the unauthorized entry of Bangladeshi nationals to Odisha via road and sea routes. “We are planning to draw the attention of the Border Security Force (BSF) as most Bangladeshi nationals illegally enter India by road. The six women who have been rehabilitated in a short stay home here are being asked to identify those who helped them enter India and get fake Aadhaar cards,” an STF officer said.

Title: Kolkata: Two dead, nine injured in five accidents in eight hours
Content:
The spot where the accident took place in Tollygunge on Wednesday morning

KOLKATA: A couple in their early 30s died and nine others were injured in five accidents that took place in the city over a span of eight hours from late Tuesday evening to Wednesday morning. Two of these accidents were reported from the Port area and one each from Central Avenue, EM Bypass and near the Tollygunge Metro station .The first accident was reported around 12.14am on Wednesday when a container truck rammed an eatery on Coal Berth Road in the Port area, injuring six. At least one of them is stated to be in a critical condition,” said an officer. The injured are driver Md Imtiar (29), eatery owners Subha Rani Ram (40) and Sunil Ram (50) customers Mohit Kumar (24) and Afzal Khan (18). The third customer is yet to be identified.Barely 15 minutes later, a couple travelling in a bike colliding with an unidentified vehicle, in all possibility a truck, on Bascule Bridge. “It seems the couple — Imran Kamal (37) and Sabina Alam (31), hailing from the Ahiripukur area — were on their way back home when the accident took place. Both of them were declared brought dead at the hospital,” said an investigating officer.The third accident took place around 2am at the Beadon Street-Central Avenue crossing when a biker jumped signal and crashed on to a truck. The truck’s tyres went over his legs. The biker is stated to be seriously wounded. At 3.30am, another biker jumped the red signal at the Chingrighata crossing while moving from Captain Bhery towards Ultadanga. A taxi was taking a right turn from Sector V towards Ultadanga. The bike hit the taxi but the biker escaped with minor injuries.The final accident was reported from near the Tollygunge police quarters between 8.10am and 8.15am on Wednesday. Haran Chandra Sil (62) was travelling towards Regent Park in his cycle from the MR Bangur Hospital side when he suddenly lost control and came under the wheels of a government bus plying on route S31 (Jadavpur to Behala Chowrasta). The wheels went over Sil’s legs. He was initially admitted to MR Bangur and then referred to SSKM Hospital. His son later shifted him to a private hospital in Salt Lake.

Title: Kolkata cops to visit Rajasthan to probe biometry theft
Content:
Representative image

KOLKATA: The cyber cell of Kolkata Police, which had received a court order to probe the alleged misuse of a housewife’s biometric identity in Rajasthan , is now readying a team to travel outside the state after initial investigations confirmed that the data was indeed “passed on to a third party for a price”.The FIR drawn up after a preliminary probe revealed the woman was indeed duped.TOI had earlier reported that a 58-year-old mother of a college student from Bhowanipore found her biometric identity being misused to get a duplicate SIM. It was reportedly used in her name in Kolkata to commit crimes in Rajasthan.According to the FIR, the cops have slapped both the Information Technology Act and the IPC sections on the accused. “On and before January2, the accused used the biometric impression and documents of the woman and procured a SIM card. The accused used the SIM card, impersonating as the complainant, to cheat people. The accused has been booked under sections 66C, 66D,72A of Information Technology Act, 2000 and sections 120B, 464, 465 and 468 of the IPC,” the FIR stated.“While frauds using data and forms provided by customers are common, the fact that biometric data has been used for forgery is a sign that this can be used for many other illegal activities,” said advocate Bivas Chatterjee. Kolkata Police refused to share details of the case saying it was a sensitive case.

Title: Trichy: Three get life term in 11-year-old murder case
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

TRICHY: A Trichy court on Wednesday convicted three people to life imprisonment for murdering a man after a dispute over monetary transactions done 11 years ago at Sangiliyandapuram here. The additional district court III awarded life imprisonment to Feroz Ahamed, 46, Pandikumar, 49, and Francis Prabhu, 49, and imposed a fine of Rs 1,000 each on them for murdering M Shahul Hameed, 40, of Dhanarathinam Nagar near Gandhi market.

The court also sentenced them to three more years of imprisonment and imposed a fine of Rs 500 on each of them for causing disappearance of evidence. Prime accused Umar Farooq, 46, the brother-in-law of Shahul Hameed, died during the trial. Shahul Hameed who returned from a job in a foreign country had gone missing from home on March 1, 2009. Based on a complaint from his wife Jawahar Nisha, Gandhi market police registered a case two days later. Since there was no progress in the investigations, Jawahar Nisha filed a habeas corpus petition in Madras high court and also pleaded to transfer the case to CBCID in 2011.

The investigation assumed a new dimension after the court transferred the case to CBCID with the officers confirming that he was murdered.
