His body was exhumed from a cemetery in the city, but police were left with no evidence to trace the accused. However, CBCID police soon managed to solve the puzzle and arrest the accused. The inquiry brought to light that Shahul Hameed used to send money to Jawahar Nisha when he was abroad.

On his return, when he asked for the money his wife told him that her family members had spent it. Subsequently, Shahul Hameed met Umar Farooq at his house and asked him to return his money. In a fit of rage, Umar Farooq strangulated Shahul to death with a belt. His friends Feroz, Pandikumar and Francis helped him to dispose the body in a cemetery by pouring sulphur on the body to erase evidence.

Title: Bumbada works his magic on city educators
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Kolkata: Students should be encouraged to share their plus and minus points with school heads and educators so that they can boost their strength and work upon their weaknesses. Moreover, the teacher-student relationship should be open and transparent, in fact more like friends. This advice came from Prosenjit Chatterjee at the Times NIE “In Conversation With Prosenjit Chatterjee ” with principals at the Tollygunge Club on Saturday. HDFC Bank was the associate partner while it was powered by ZTrack, a unit of Funscholar Innovations Pvt. Ltd.

The Tollywood superstar had everyone in the Yule 150 hall spellbound for over an hour as he held forth on his childhood, school days, film career, fitness secrets and his life as a parent in an informal chat with well-known painter Ashok Haralalka.“Prosenjit Chatterjee is my brand, but I would like to be remembered as a human being first, as Bumba” he averred right at the onset.

The actor got many a moment to go down memory lane as he spoke about ‘Chhoto Jigyasa’, his first film as a child star. “I was barely four-and-a-half or five years old when I did that film, so I have very faint memories. But yes I remember I would eagerly say ‘I am ready for shooting, shooting khela’. We had a bungalow in Tollygunge and the entire unit stayed there during the shoot. I also remember running barefoot on Bally Bridge for the final shot and despite all the pain I kept running. People then said I had the ability to bare pain like a military man,” said Chatterjee who became emotional talking about the late Rituparno Ghosh.

Talking about his school days, he said that initially he was in South Point School and then was shifted to St Xavier’s Collegiate School. “I feel so good, like a god whenever I walk through those corridors....I always make it a point to go back to SXC to interact with the students. I owe so much to St Xavier’s... my days there taught me how to be disciplined and inspired me to become an actor.” About his son, he added, “Trishanjit is not interested in doing films, rather he is very keen to become an international soccer player. I have sent him to London to study and also get a chance to play good football. Arpita and I sent him to hostel in Kodaikanal as we wanted him to have a normal childhood away from Tollywood and the media.”

The Q and A session had his audience asking him the secret behind his youth, despite having crossed 50 years. “Not just me even Ajay Devgan, Akshay Kumar all seem more energetic after 45. It’s all inside your mind. My diet is like that of a sportsman,” he laughed. The event also saw presentations by HDFC Bank and Funscholar. Bumbada also unveiled the latter’s Ztrack, India’s first wearable tech watch for schools.

Title: Woman loots Santoshpur shop
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Kolkata: A 43-year-old owner of a boutique at Santoshpur Avenue has alleged that she fell victim to an unusual method of kepmari while she was managing her shop on Monday. A 50-year-old woman, reportedly a history-sheeter, is the prime suspect.

According to victim Mithu Mallick, a resident of Selimpur Lane, a dark complexioned healthy woman aged around 50 had come to her shop around 11am on Monday. “She waited for a couple of minutes before asking me to show some sarees. I had climbed up a few stairs to bring sarees from the store when I felt some liquid hit me. The woman then applied some strange balm on my hand. Even as the woman told me that I looked ill and I needed rest, I realized she was tugging at my gold chain. I could only feebly protest before I lost consciousness,” Mallick said.

The accused calmly removed all the jewellery from Mallick and took away Rs 17,000 in cash. Joint CP (crime) Murlidhar Sharma said they had received leads about the accused from CCTV footage. “She seems an old hand. Mallick has had a history of epilepsy. We are looking at all possible angles,” said Sharma.

Title: Goa Bazaar stalled, RDA mantri Lobo cites ‘admin issues’
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Panaji: The government’s proposal to setup Goa Bazaar on 30,000sqm of land at Merces with Rs 12 crore funding from the Centre is now stuck for want of administrative approvals.The rural development agency has already prepared the plans for the buildings and is waiting for approval from the expenditure finance committee before floating a tender for the project.

A senior bureaucrat has stalled the move to construct a space for artisans and women entrepreneurs, along the lines of Dilli Haat in the national capital, on the grounds that the site chosen for Goa Bazaar is a low- lying area, said rural development agency (RDA) minister Michael Lobo.

“Some secretary of some department has raised a query asking why we are building in a low-lying area. We have brought this to the chief minister’s attention, and we will have a meeting with him,” said Lobo, speaking to reporters at the CM’s official residence at Altinho.

The Union government had sanctioned Rs 12 crore for creation of Goa Bazaar with a condition that the funds have to be utilised within four years. RDA had acquired land at Merces but the land was subsequently divided and handed over for construction of the district court complex, said RDA director Sanjit Rodrigues.“When the funds were sanctioned, there was no plan. Now the plans have been made by GSIDC ,” he said.The district court complex is nearing completion, while Goa Bazaar has yet to get government approval. The project envisages minimal construction and the use of natural elements for the design of the 200-odd stalls for artisans and SHGs.

“The money is still lying with us. The utilisation of the money is for a period of 3-4 years, but we have not sent the money back. We are telling the Centre that we are doing it,” Lobo said. The minister said that Goa Bazaar can give self-help groups, women entrepreneurs and Goan artisans a year-round platform to promote and sell their products.

Title: BMC busts polythene-making unit in Bhubhaneswar’s Bhagawanpur
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

The illegal unit may be sealed

BHUBANESWAR: The Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Wednesday dismantled an unauthorised polythene carry bag manufacturing unit at Bhagawanpur.

Acting on a tip-off, a special enforcement squad of the BMC conducted a raid and seized a large quantity of polythene bags. BMC additional commissioner Abani Patnaik said the unit was illegal because it was making polythene bags of less than 50 micron thickness, which are banned.

“The raid was conducted in the presence of police and officers from the Odisha State Pollution Control Board. The unit also did not have an updated trade licence certificate,” said Patnaik.

The squad has also seized the raw materials used to make the bags. “There was a huge stock of raw materials at the facility, besides machinery and water containers. The pollution control board will take a call on whether the unit will be sealed,” said a BMC officer.

The BMC had earlier said there was no manufacturer of plastic bags in the city. The illegal unit couldn’t be traced initially as it had not obtained a trade licence. The BMC was under the impression that wholesalers were buying polythene carry bags from outside Odisha.

The enforcement squad of the BMC has been conducting raids since October 2, 2019, to ensure that the banned polythene bags are no longer in circulation and are replaced by alternatives like paper and woven bags. On October 2, the state government had placed a blanket ban on single-use polythene across all 114 urban local bodies. On the same day, it had announced a ban on polythene in five cities.

In another development, the BMC squad intercepted a truck carrying banned polythene plates and bowls in Khandagiri. The police were asked to seize the truck. “We have imposed a fine of Rs 50,000 on the truck owners for transporting banned polythene plates. The consignment was coming from Cuttack,” said an officer.

Title: Trade fair boosting women, rural artisans begins today
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Panaji: The 12-day trade fair for rural artisans, Saras, will be held at SGPDA grounds, Margao, from Thursday.

Rural development agency minister Michael Lobo said 200 stalls will be put up to help self-help groups (SHGs) and women artisans to earn an income.

The South Goa District Rural Development Agency is organising the festival, with the state and Centre contributing Rs 35 lakh each.

“This will bring a lot of income and revenue for SHGs, this is our main purpose,” Lobo said. He also said that the state government sought to hold the Saras festival twice a year even if it has to foot the entire bill. Saras is an annual event where SHGs from across the country use common financial resources to sell their products. It is also organised in other states to which the state rural development agency sends artisans from Goa to promote and sell their products.

At the last Saras, artisans and SHGs earned an income of Rs 1.3 crore. This year, around 250 artisans will participate in the fair.

Aside from the trade fair, there will be games for children and entertainment programmes on all the days to enhance public participation.

Title: Anti-CAA, NRC stir launched in Latur, continues in other parts
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

A file photo shows an anti-CAA and NRC poster at a protest site

AURANGABAD: Nonagenarian freedom fighter Murgappa Kulse led hundreds of Latur residents in their protest against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and National Register for Citizen (NRC) at the Dr Ambedkar Park in the city.

Latur activists began their three-day sit-in agitation from Wednesday evening at the Dr Ambedkar Park, where hundreds of people had gathered to express their solidarity with the protesters. Different groups have come together to form ‘Amhi Laturkar, CAA, NRC Virodhi Jan Andolan’, to resist the CAA and NRC.

Uday Gaware, a lawyer activist, said that despite his age, Kulse joined the agitation because he feels that the new law was intended at dividing the people.

“The central government’s move was an attempt to create a rift between different communities and cause havoc and confusion in the country. This was being done to divert people’s attention from core issues such as falling economy, increasing prices of essential commodities and rising unemployment,” Gaware claimed.

Intellectuals and social activists from across the country were expected to arrive in Latur over the next couple of days to join in their agitation.

Gaware said that these moves were not limited to targeting Muslims, but the government intended to hit Hindus too, particularly sections like Adivasi, OBC, Buddhists, and other communities.

Meanwhile, a group of lawyers in Beed staged anti-CAA and NRC agitation in front of the district court on Wednesday demanding the government to scrap the controversial law, while the sit-in agitation launched at different places including Nanded and Aurangabad continued on Wednesday.

Title: Bombay HC notice to Umred MLA Raju Parwe
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representational Image

NAGPUR: The Nagpur bench of Bombay high court on Wednesday issued notice to Congress legislator from Umred Raju Parwe on a petition challenging his victory in assembly elections held in October last year.

Justice Vinay Deshpande asked the MLA to reply within six weeks. The judge also directed the registry to club all pleas challenging Parwe’s election and list it together.

Petitioner Shivaji Sonkusare from Kuhi, through counsel Uday Dable, alleged that Parwe did not disclose details of his income tax returns filed by him in last five years in the affidavit submitted to the state election commission.

According to him, the Representation of People’s Act makes it mandatory for all candidates to submit their income tax details for last five years, but Parwe had mentioned information related to only one year.

The petitioner had earlier raised same objection before collector-cum-returning officer, but he ignored all complaints.

Subsequently, he won the polls by defeating BJP’s sitting MLA Sudhir Parwe. The petitioner then knocked judiciary’s doors.

Sonkusare prayed for cancellation of Parwe’s victory from Umred as he had allegedly violated the provisions of Representation of People’s Act.

Title: Illegal parking rife at Margao railway station
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

The Margao taxi drivers and operators association comprising yellow and black taxis went to court alleging tha... Read More

PANAJI: The transport department has recorded 143 cases of private taxis and other violators parking illegally outside and behind the Konkan railway station in Margao . In the year 2018, 262 violators were found and penalised.

The Margao taxi drivers and operators association comprising yellow and black taxis went to court alleging that private taxi operators, rickshaws and motorcycles were depriving them of carrying out their business legally, by operating from the space that was notified for them.

The association alleged that the director of transport had not taken effective steps to implement the court’s 2013 order. The high court on April 4, 2013 had directed the government to prevent tourist taxi operators and private vehicles on hire from illegally and unauthorisedly parking and operating from the approach road outside and behind Konkan railway station in Margao.

The court in 2013 had also directed the government to prevent black and yellow rickshaws and motorcycles from parking and operating in the space notified for black and yellow taxis.

The counsel representing the Margao taxi drivers and operator’s association, advocate Sanman Keny submitted to the court that tourist taxis and operators of private vehicles were illegally parking on the approach road behind the railway station, despite a legal notice to the assistant director of transport, (enforcement wing) Margao.

At the last hearing on Monday, advocate general Devidas Pangam assured the court that necessary steps would be taken to comply with the April 2013 order. The district magistrate of South Goa in 1997 had notified a stand for 15 black and yellow cabs on the left side of the approach road to the station, and another stand on the right side for 20 black and yellow rickshaws and 10 motorcycles. In 2000, a notification was issued permitting parking for 15 additional taxis, taking the total to 30. The stand was later notified as a ‘parking place’.

In 2008, the Margao taxi drivers and operators association was awarded a tender to operate a prepaid taxi counter for five years commencing from 2008 upon payment of license fee of Rs 95,000 per year apart from electricity charges and security deposits.

Title: Business worth Rs 150cr in 4-day Massia expo
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Aurangabad: The recent Advantage Maharashtra Expo 2020, conducted by Marathwada Association of Small Scale Industries and Agriculture (Massia) received overwhelming as business transaction worth Rs 150 crore took place during the four-day event.

As many as 448 stalls were put up and over 1 lakh people visited the event.

Speaking to reporters, convener of the expo Sunil R Kirdak and Massia president Dnyandeo Rajale said the international expo was inaugurated by chief minister Uddhav Thackeray on and it concluded in the presence of union MSME minister Nitin Gadkari.

“We were waiting for the feedback from the 448 entrepreneurs and institutions that had set up their stalls on the Kalagram premises. Around 400 of them have said that they would participate in next year’s expo. `We are planning a similar grand exhibition next year where we would install 600 stalls,’’ Kirdak said.

“All the government departments and agencies concerned had extended their support to make the event a big success,” said Rajale.

Title: AAP Manifesto: 24x7 markets in Delhi? AAP readies its poll manifesto
Content:
File photo of Meena Bazar market area in Delhi

NEW DELHI: Following the Mumbai model, Delhi may get 24x7 markets if Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) wins the February 8 assembly elections. Inclusion of dentistry, dermatology and mental health facilities in polyclinics, a premium bus service, shelters for homeless people and multiple small sports complexes are likely to be among other promises to be included in the party manifesto.A three-member committee headed by Atishi, the key brain behind AAP government ’s education policies who has been fielded from Kalkaji, is finalising the manifesto, which is likely to be released on Sunday.According to a source, AAP is exploring the option of keeping some markets open 24x7 on a pilot basis to give Delhiites a night life and help businesses grow. The project will be extended to more markets if the pilot proves successful.The idea is to make the capital function like other big cities across the world, said the source. The launch of the 24-hour markets, however, requires proper security arrangements. All aspects of the project will be considered and every stakeholders will be taken into confidence before launching the project, he said.The government has already installed 1.4 lakh CCTV cameras across Delhi and another 1.4 lakh are being installed to make the city safer for everybody, especially women, the source said. The government has also started installing 2.5 lakh streetlights to make the capital free of dark spots.The manifesto is also likely to promise a premium bus service for reducing the traffic load on the roads. “Premium buses will eye the white-collar commuters who are in search of a better transport facility. The rides will not only be comfortable and pleasant but also help in reducing traffic congestion and curb air pollution,” said the source, adding that all roads will also be paved to contain dust.The party will promise a robust transport system with over 11,000 buses, over 500 km metro network, and better last-mile connectivity. A better public transport system will also make the city safer for women, the source said.The manifesto is likely to draw largely from “Kejriwal Ki 10 Guarantee”, released recently by chief minister Arvind Kejriwal. The 10-point document has promised 24-hour clean piped water to every household; quality education to all till graduation; cheap, accessible and better healthcare for all; largest and cheapest transport system; pollution-free Delhi; clean and beautiful Delhi; safe Delhi for women; basic infrastructure in all unauthorised colonies and a pukka house for all slum dwellers.The manifesto will promise replacing overhead electricity cables with underground ones, cleaning the Yamuna, checking arbitrary fee hikes in private schools, and creating a world-class education system for every child. More mohalla clinics, polyclinics and hospitals will also be part of the manifesto.The other members of the manifesto committee are Dialogue and Development Commision of Delhi vice-chairperson Jasmine Shah and former Jamshedpur MP Ajoy Kumar who joined AAP a few months ago.

Title: Gujarat: Tax officer caught taking Rs 15,000 from pharma wholesaler
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

VADODARA: A state tax officer by the anti-corruption bureau in Kuber Bhavan on Wednesday.

The accused Priti Vispute was caught red-handed accepting Rs 15,000 from a pharmaceutical wholesaler. Vispute had demanded the money to reduce the amount of tax and issue assessment order.

The complainant had received a notice from the office of assistant state tax commissioner around four months back regarding the payment of value-added tax (VAT) for the financial year 2015-16. The complainant reached Vispute’s office along with all documents. Vispute told him that double entries were made by him in his books of accounts.

For the error, the complainant was asked to pay Rs 12 lakh penalty along with interest and an additional amount of Rs 80,000 as tax. ACB officials said that Vispute later told the complainant that she can reduce the tax amount as much as she can, but the wholesaler will have to pay Rs 15,000.

As the complainant did not want to bribe her, he informed ACB. On receiving the complaint, a trap was laid and the pharmaceutical wholesaler went to pay the bribe amount on Wednesday. After a brief conversation, Vispute accepted the money and immediately ACB officials raided her office on the fourth floor of Kuber Bhavan.

ACB officials refused to divulge details and said that Vispute will be produced before a special ACB court on Thursday.

Title: Crimes against kids in Tamil Nadu rise 250% in five years
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: Nearly half of all crimes against children in Tamil Nadu are sexual offences and their number has also gone up by 18% in 2017-18, according an analysis by Child Rights and You (CRY) of the 2018 National Crime Records Bureau (NCRB) data.

Crimes against children in Tamil Nadu rose 250% in the last five years, revealed the analysis. And, 49% of all the crimes came under The Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (Pocso) Act. The 18% rise in the number of sexual offences is almost double the national average of 9.9%. Christuraj Savarinayagam, advocate and child rights activist, pointed out that this could be because of better reporting, “but the rate of crime is also worrying”.

“Perpetrators are getting smarter, tactful and finding new ways to abuse children. The state needs to put in place strong child protection systems in every village, town and city to combat such crimes,” Savarinayagam said.

A total of 4,155 crimes were reported against children in Tamil Nadu during the past one year, which accounts for 3% of the crimes against children reported across the country. Tamil Nadu is also one of five states that reported the most cases of procuring of minor girls. There has been a 95% increase in the number of cases reported in the state over a period of one year — 76 cases reported in 2017 and 148 cases in 2018. During this time, the national average declined by 10%.

“It is really worrying to see Tamil Nadu recording so many crimes against children, especially under the Pocso Act. While education, awareness and community vigilance are key factors, more money flowing into child protection will be crucial to arrest this trend,” said Karthik Narayanan, regional director, CRY south.

A few months ago, the department of social welfare had announced that it would maintain its own registry of child sexual offenders, with the home department, to curb abuse in Tamil Nadu.

The registry would have the address and biometric details of offenders like the national registry for sex offenders. This would help police keep a watch on offenders and ensure that they are not found near schools, parks or areas frequented by children. In case they migrate, authorities in the states concerned would be alerted.

“The registry will be released soon, we are working on it,” said a senior official from social welfare department.

Title: Co-op bank admits to Rs 600 cr NPAs, 69 major defaulters
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Bengaluru: Sri Gururaghavendra Sahakara Bank Nimyamita (SGSBN), a Bengaluru-based co-operative bank which was in news recently after the Reserve Bank of India ( RBI ) imposed curbs on cash withdrawals from it, has admitted that its non-performing assets ( NPAs ) are worth Rs 600 crore and 69 of its major borrowers are defaulters .

The admission came during a meeting the bank officials had on Tuesday with their members.

Bank sources said the deposits with the bank totalled Rs 2,800 crore, while its outstanding loans stood at Rs 1,677 crore. The bank’s NPAs are what led the RBI the restrict withdrawals. The 69 major defaulters owe the bank of Rs 372 crore. However, the bank has 100% collaterals against the NPAs, the officials said.

The bank told customers that after RBI's intervention, Rs 32 crore was recovered from borrowers and another Rs 55 crore will be recovered by January 31.

The bank started issuing notices to borrowers from Monday under the Securitisation and Reconstruction of Financial Assets and Enforcement of Securities Interest (SARFAESI) Act.

Sources said, after RBI's intervention that an account holder should be allowed to withdraw not more than Rs 35,000, Rs 25 crore had been pulled out of the bank. It has also been discovered that the bank had purchased an asset worth Rs 19.9 crore.

The bank told its customers, "RBI has been auditing our accounts every year for 10 years but could not find any flaw. For the first time, they rang an alarm bell and gave us 42 days. However, they did not wait for 42 days and imposed the withdrawal cap.”

While many customers expressed concerns over lack of transparency, the management has agreed to publish a weekly report on recoveries. The bank has also submitted to the RBI applications from its account holders seeking exemption citing medical emergencies.

The bank has stated that it has a strategy in place to recover Rs 100 crore by the end of January and Rs 200 crore by the end of February and Rs 175 crore by March end.

The management said they are not likely to go for elections as only 901 of the 8,000 shareholders turned up for the meeting and a majority of them are not eligible to vote as they had not appeared for three consecutive general body meetings.

Title: VPT moots international trade hub near airport
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Visakhapatnam: A free trade and warehousing zone (FTWZ) has been proposed to be set up by the Visakhapatnam Port Trust ( VPT ) near the port exim park near the airport. The FTWZ , which will be spread across 106 acres, will be considered a special economic zone governed under the 2001 SEZ Act and SEZ rules, 2006.

“The project will cost around Rs 500 crore, most of which is expected to be funded by the VPT and Sagarmala Development Corporation Ltd (SDCL). A draft DPR for the same was prepared by the Indian Ports Association on January 2,” a senior port official said.

VPT deputy chairman PL Haranadh confirmed the development. “We have already formulated a DPR, and a SPV will be formed soon. Once that happens, we can fix a timeline for the project,” he told TOI.

FTWZ is designated as a deemed foreign territory and is envisaged to be integrated zones to be used as international trading hubs. FTWZ status allows units to provide value added services to customers including packing, re-packing, labelling, knitting and bundling among other services . Thus, the zones could act as consolidation or distribution hubs for foreign and Indian clients alike.

As per the initial blueprint, land utilisation has been divided into three parts: Processing zone, non-processing zone and infrastructure-related land in the ratio of 69:12:19, an official said.

“Processing zone would primarily include warehousing zones of various kinds. The infrastructure zone would have roads and drainage facilities. The non-processing zone will comprise facilities such as power, fire, restrooms, green belt, truck terminal, office space and miscellaneous functions,” the officer added.

SDCL is expected to invest around Rs 240 crore towards infrastructure and other work related to the project. Both VPT and SDCL will form an special purpose vehicle (SPV) which will invest around Rs 110 crore to run the facility and retain earnings from the project. The cost of land provided by VPT is Rs 150 crore.

“As per proposal, road shows and awareness campaigns will be conducted to pick up the demand of the FTWZ. It’s an important project because the region lacks any facility of this nature,” an official pointed out.

Title: Surat fake currency racket: One held from Palitana
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

The accused, Pradeep Chopra

Rajkot: One of the accused in Rs 1 crore counterfeit currency racket busted in Surat was arrested from Nanimal village of Palitana taluka in Bhavnagar district on Wednesday.

Police said the accused, identified as Pradeep Chopra (23), was arrested on the basis of a tip-off about his whereabouts in Nanimal village.

“After arresting Chopra we informed our counterparts of Surat crime branch and handed over Chopra’s custody to them,” said S N Barot, inspector with Bhavnagar special operation group.

The counterfeit currency with face value Rs 50 lakh was seized from Swami Radharaman on November 24 last year. The sadhu was arrested from Swaminarayan temple ashram in Ambav village of Kheda district.

On November 23 last year, Surat crime branch had arrested Pratik Chodwadia from a farm house near Kamrej and recovered 203 fake notes of Rs 2,000 denomination from him. During his interrogation, he revealed the names of four others including Swami Radharaman.

The other three accused, Pravin Chopra, Kalu Chopra and Mohan Wadhurade, were arrested from Sarthana in Surat district.

Title: Telangana sees smooth polling as more than 70% ink fingers
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

A senior citizen is helped by workers at a polling station in Gundlapochampally.

HYDERABAD: The elections for 120 municipalities and nine municipal corporations across the state on Wednesday saw a huge turnout. However, in districts bordering Hyderabad such as Medchal-Malkajgiri and Rangareddy turnouts were relatively low. The state election commission (SEC) said that Nalgonda district saw the highest turnout.

The SEC is likely to order re-polling for one booth in Ward 41 of Kamareddy municipality where a tender vote was polled. The commission has asked the Kamareddy collector to submit a report on the incident.

The SEC announced that the average voter turnout across the state was little over 70% with Choutuppal recording the highest turnout (93.31%) and Nizampet the lowest (39.65%).

In the IT belt, turnout remained relatively low as companies did not declare a holiday for voting. In some cases, officials said, some IT employees came in to vote during the first two hours of polling.

Polling went on smoothly across the states except a few stray incidents of cases between workers of different parties. Incidents of violence were reported from erstwhile Mahabubnagar, Khammam, Nizamabad, Rangareddy and Karimnagar districts. Most scuffles were over allegations by various political parties on the use of money and other items to influence voters. On the day of polling, five cases of assault pertaining to polls had been recorded across state.

In Nalgonda and Wyra police arrested workers from political parties who were allegedly distributing liquor and cash to voters on Tuesday night. Nizamabad police registered a case against TRS 41 ward candidate Changubai for allegedly distributing cash and liquor. In some cases, police had to resort to light lathicharge to disperse crowds.

Though there were no major complaints of missing names in the electoral lists, in Nizamabad municipal corporation, people in Wards 35 and 36 claimed around 150 names were missing in the voter list.

Title: Telangana civic polls: Facial recognition tech helps cast vote within minutes, a hit among voters
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

A polling staff in Kompally uses a smartphone to take photos of voters

KOMPALLY: It took just three minutes for D Dharani, a final-year BCom student, to cast her vote and leave the polling booth. What helped her finish the process of exercising her franchise within minutes was the facial recognition technology.

“I came to the polling booth for the first time. I wondered what were the polling staff doing using a smartphone,” said Dharani, who voted at the Zilla Parishad High School, Kompally.

The State Election Commission (SEC) launched the facial recognition technology for voters of select 10 polling stations in Kompally Municipality of Medchal Malkajgiri district. A total of 7,700 voters cast their vote at these 10 polling stations.

The use of the new technology entails a polling official verifying a voter’s ID proof using a smartphone, and then taking his/her photo. The voter’s photo is then upload on the server using ‘face recognition app’.

This image is tallied with the photo on the voters’ list. If, the image is tallied, a green mark appears on the smartphone, stating he/she is a genuine voter.

“It is highly appreciable that the State Election Commission (SEC) has used such a technology to ease the voting process. They should continue this for assembly and Lok Sabha elections,” Dharani told TOI.

MNR Jyoti, Kompally municipal commissioner and assistant district election authority, said: “A voter who enters with a polling slip and voter ID card comes out after exercising his/her vote within two minutes, thanks to the facial recognition app. We cannot download this app from Play Store. The Telangana State Technology Services (TSTS), which developed this technology, trained 10 polling personnel. We have purchased 10 smartphones exclusively for this purpose.”

A couple, N Ratna Kumari, a homemaker, and N Suresh, a techie, were also excited about the use of technology in the electoral process. “It is a good initiative launched by the SEC, that too in Kompally municipality,” Suresh told TOI. “Bogus voters can be filtered out through this newly launched facial recognition technology,” said M Arjun Reddy, a resident of NCL Colony, Kompally.

Title: Gangadhar Meher University takes steps to make campus disabled-friendly
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

SAMBALPUR: To make the campus disabled-friendly, the Gangadhar Meher University ( GMU ) will construct a ramp in the varsity building at an estimated cost of Rs 61.87 lakh. Deputy registrar U C Pati said the central public works department (CPWD) has finalised a firm that would execute the work. It will be funded under Rashtriya Uchchatar Shiksha Abhiyan (RUSA).

Pati said the ramp will originate from near the lecture gallery no.1 and connect to lecture gallery no. 2 in the first floor and from there it will connect to the commerce department. “Work will start by the month-end and work on the ramp will be completed within three months,” he said.

He said since the university building is an old one it does not have a ramp now. “Because of the absence of a ramp, the disabled students often face problems in attending classes on the first floor. There are around five disabled students in the institution now. Currently, we provide a tricycle to the disabled students to go to their classes on the ground floor. But they face problems in attending classes on the first and second floors,” he added.

He said a toilet block is being constructed on the premises of the varsity at an estimated cost of Rs 77. 58 lakh. “We have made special arrangements for the disabled in the toilet block too. This apart, we have also decided to have a lift in the new multi-storey academic building so that disabled students will not have to face any difficulty in attending classes,” he said.

Title: Bengaluru: Draft CMP gets 475 citizen responses; most oppose elevated road proposal
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

The plan suggests 33%-50% of the new road capacity be earmarked for public transport

BENGALURU: The draft Comprehensive Mobility Plan (CMP) released by Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited (BMRCL) and Directorate of Urban Land Transport (DULT) has received as many as 475 responses from Bengalureans.

It was in public domain since December 6 and the last date for submission of comments/suggestions was January 20.

“A total of 475 responses have been received by DULT and BMRCL. A mail sent on behalf of several people is counted as one response. That shows that a large number of people have read the document and hopefully given constructive suggestions. Each suggestion will be considered carefully and thereafter, a final document will be submitted by DULT and BMRCL to the government,” BMRCL managing director Ajay Seth told TOI.

An online campaign initiated by Citizens for Bengaluru and Jhatkaa.org on act.airalert.in, which has garnered 3,244 signatures, acted as a platform for citizens to send comments on CMP. Other cities have seen lukewarm response to CMPs.

Many activists questioned the two agencies for coming up with a CMP, saying it’s not their job. However, most respondents objected to inclusion of elevated corridors in the plan.

“The Centre’s Metro Policy 2017 requires every city wanting a Metro network to have a CMP. If Bengaluru needs new Metro lines, including ORR-airport line, it has to have a CMP. There is no law which mandates or prohibits any particular agency from preparing it. Ultimately, it’s a government document which has to be approved by the government. All government agencies concerned were consulted while drawing up the document,” said a senior official from the urban development department (UDD).

“DULT and BMRCL jointly formulated CMP on the government’s directions. An activist group had filed a writ petition a few months ago seeking direction to the government and its agencies to prepare the plan. Another group recently asked people not to make suggestions as it felt the document was illegal,” he added.

On inclusion of the elevated corridor in CMP, he said: “The plan has proposed Metrolite along north, south and central ring alignment of elevated roads and suggested review of the currently approved elevated roads. It has suggested that 33%-50% of the new road capacity, including on the elevated corridor, be earmarked for public transport (exclusive bus lanes). In fact, it suggests elevated roads as the last option.”

The official clarified: “The government approved ORR Metro in 2017. But the Centre hadn’t considered the request so far for want of a CMP. Mere inclusion in CMP doesn’t mean an elevated road or any other project has been approved. Each project has to go through the process of alternative investment analysis and appraisal before being given administrative approval.”

Title: Dairy Circle-Hosur Road stretch to open on Monday
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Marigowda Road wears a new look

BENGALURU: The Dr MH Marigowda Road stretch from Dairy Circle towards Hosur Road which had been closed to vehicles for nearly three months for whitetopping is set to open on Monday.

The 1.4-km stretch was riddled with potholes, prompting the civic body to take up whitetopping on November 11, 2019.

"I am glad that I will be using this road again because it will save so much time. Earlier I had to take a detour for my commute from Shantinagar to Tavarekere and ended up spending 20 more minutes," said Rahul Nair, a resident of Tavarekere.

Apeksha Muthappa, a student of Christ College, said she is more than glad as the road will now open. "I had to start early just to reach college because the road was blocked,” she said.

Due to the whitetopping work, motorists had to take a diversion at Dairy Circle and travel through Bannerghatta road, Mico Road Cross and SG Palya and reach Forum Mall to get back to Hosur Road.

“The white-topping had to happen sooner, but it was taken up under the second package of the first phase of white-topping, which was sanctioned in 2017,” said a senior BBMP official, adding that the work was delayed due to the proposed metro work and delayed approval for traffic diversion.

BTM Layout MLA Ramalinga Reddy told TOI, “This is the first time that a white-topping project has actually been executed and completed on time.”

Admitting that there was a little inconvenience to road users, Reddy said people will now be able to commute without any accidents due to potholes.

Asked when the work on the other carriageway of the road carrying traffic from Hosur Road to Dairy Circle would be taken up, Reddy said it would begin in a month or so.

Title: Karimnagar commissioner of police behaving like TRS man, says BJP MP
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Karimnagar MP Bandi Sanjay

HYDERABAD: BJP MP Bandi Sanjay said that Karimnagar commissioner of police VB Kamalasan Reddy is behaving like a TRS worker rather than a police officer.

The Karimnagar MP alleged that stones were pelted at him during campaigning few days ago and said he faced a threat to his life. However, the CP said there was no attack on Sanjay and only rumours were being spread.

Kamalasan said the information circulating on WhatsApp and social media was wrong. “We have been protecting public representatives with utmost care. If there indeed was an attack on Sanjay, he would have brought it to our notice,” he said.

The MP said he did not rake up the issue before as it would have provoked his party workers leading to a law and order issue. He alleged that Kamalasan’s bias towards TRS was not acceptable.

Title: Runway extension: Jakkur airfield officials seek govt intervention
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

A view of Jakkur Aerodrome

Title: Gujarat: 21 cartridges found from former cop’s farmhouse
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

The accused duo in police custody.

VADODARA: A retired policeman and caretaker of his farmhouse were arrested on Wednesday after 21 cartridges of a revolver, a rifle and a spear were found from there in Mobha village of Padra taluka.

Vadu police station and Daman police sleuths searched the farmhouse of the retired cop Imaambaksh Baloch after caretaker Pradhyuman Patel admitted that a murder accused from Daman named Suresh alias Sukho Patel was hiding in the farmhouse. On reaching the farmhouse, police could not find Suresh, but on searching the house they found 11 cartridges of .32mm revolver and 10 cartridges of .315 8mm rifle.

On questioning Baloch, he admitted that the cartridges of revolver belonged to him while that of rifle were of Suresh. A license of holding rifle in the name of Suresh was found and an application for an arms license was also found. Cops also found a hatchback car from the farm. Police said that the papers found in the car revealed that it was owned by a man named Manoj Thakor living in Palghar in Maharashtra. Baloch told cops that the car was being used by Suresh.

Police registered an offence under Arms Act against the trio. While Baloch and Pradhyuman were arrested, Suresh has been declared wanted.

A police official said that cops from Daman police station had received information about Pradhyuman based on which he was picked up and interrogated. Police sources said that Baloch retired recently from Kheda and spent long time in Vadodara police. He was also booked by the anti-corruption bureau for holding disproportionate assets.

Title: ID Hospital readies ward for coronavirus
Content: Kolkata: The state’s referral hospital for infectious diseases, ID Hospital Beliaghata, has kept its isolation ward ready amid a scare over coronavirus . A team from Swasthya Bhawan, the state’s health headquarters, on Wednesday inspected the wards and checked the preparedness of the hospital.“We have kept our isolation ward prepared in case we get any coronavirus patient. Our medical team is ready as well,” said Anima Halder, principal at ID Hospital Beliaghata.The hospital already has two specialised isolation wards, each with eight beds, one for Nipa and the other for Ebola virus. These wards will be utilised in case the city gets any coronavirus case. The hospital management, however, conveyed to the team from Swasthya Bhawan that more nursing staff would be required in case an actual outbreak takes place or even to tackle a few cases.

Title: Telangana: Tempers rage in the heat of polls
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

A TRS candidate injured during a clash with a Congress candidate at Bodhan in Nizamabad

HYDERABAD: Stray incidents of clashes between supporters of different political parties were reported across the state on Wednesday. The scuffles broke out over allegations of influencing voters during the municipal polls.

In Nizmabad’s Bodhan municipality, a TRS candidate was injured after a Congress candidate allegedly bit the former’s nose. The TRS worker, Imran, was admitted to hospital as he was bleeding profusely. The Congress worker was taken into custody following a complaint by TRS. In Gadwal’s Ganjipet booth, a clash broke out between supporters of AIMIM and Congress. “It was mild scuffle which took place between two contesting candidates near a polling station. Police controlled the situation immediately. We will be registering a case against the concerned persons,’’ Gadwal SP K Apoorva Rao told TOI.

Similarly in Boduppal’s Ward 6, there was a scuffle between TRS and Congress over an allegation of distribution of money to influence voters. In another ward, a Congress supporter was allegedly heckled by TRS cadres. Supporters of BJP and TRS in Alkapur also accused each other of influencing voters, an altercation broke between supporters of both parties over being allowed inside the booth.

Police had to resort to light lathicharge in Rangareddy’s Jalpally municipality to disperse the crowd around a polling booth. Few in the area alleged that the police were TRS supporters and had neglected bogus voting in Ward 11.

Few incidents of candidates luring voters also came to fore. Police arrested a candidate with Rs 5 lakh cash in Boduppal while another person was taken into custody from Kamareddy for distributing nose rings to women voters. In Badangpet, police had to step in to break a scuffle between Congress and TRS cadres. Additional forces were deployed after the incident.

According to director general of police (law and order) Jitender, a total of 21 election-related cases had been registered of which five pertained to assault. “The assault cases were booked in Gadwal, Bodhan and Khammam. In Khammam and Bodhan, it was a complaint and counter-complaint from the other party. The rest of the cases were related to bogus voting, distribution of money and other election code violations. There were no major incidents of violence,” Jitender said.

Title: Voters’ blues: One family, multiple booths
Content:
Many IT staffers came in to cast their vote early in the day in Manikonda and head to work directly.

Work comes in the way of vote

HYDERABAD: Several people were irked as members from the same family were allotted different wards even though they had a common address.In the Ameenpur municipality, three members of Dilip Kumar’s family were listed at three separate wards. “I went to ward 7 polling booth to cast my vote. Even though my father Ramachandra Reddy and brother Dinesh live in the same house, they were allotted ward 1 and ward 8 respectively.”Shesha Prasad, from Tellapur, had a similar experience. “We are four voters from the same family, but were allotted two wards -- 10 and 11.” Speaking about the inconvenience, Prasad said, “I cannot understand the reasoning behind how one family, who have the same address, can belong to two wards?”Nagaraja Ravoori, from the same area, said while his family was supposed to vote at ward 10, his wife’s name finally appeared on the ward 8 list. “We found out after reaching the booth,” he said.On a larger scale, Venkat Ram Reddy, from Mayfair villas, said his entire community was separately listed in different wards. “While you can assume that we would be spilt among a few wards, people’s names were listed is as many as five different wards. So community members could be seen at different poll booths in this part of town.” In Boduppal, a man on condition of anonymity, said, “My wife and I voted in booth allotted for 16 ward, but my son’s name was at the 28th ward.”Many IT staffers came in to cast their vote early in the day in Manikonda and head to work directly.While a GO stated that government offices, public and private undertakings must declare a holiday to ensure that employees can vote, several techies had to rush to offices located further awayRam Shankar, who works at Hexagon in Madhapur, said that he did not get a day’s break from work. “I will have to travel to work now,” he said after voting. Most decisions regarding leaves or relaxation in timings were left to discretion of companies.Meanwhile, government employees in municipalities said that their request for special causal leave was rejected and that they were not even given few hours permission to cast their votes.An employee with Telangana State Technology Services, under the IT department, said that staff were denied leave. “For GHMC polls, a local holiday was declared for those working in GHMC limits. But for municipal polls, I was denied special leave in spite of living in one of the polling areas,” the employee said.

Title: Telangana civic elections: There was a poll? Locals in Dabeerpura unaware
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

A deserted polling booth in Dabeerpura division on Wednesday

HYDERABAD: Dabeerpura ’s Ward 30, the only ward under Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) going for election, saw a turnout of just over 27%. Investigation by TOI revealed that most residents were not even aware that the election was taking place.

In some cases, locals said that they had not even received voter slips while many opined that they had lost interest in polls as there had been no development in the past few years. They said they were aware of NOTA but chose to stay at home instead. “Unlike regular polls, we did not get voter slips. My family informed me this morning (about the election) but when I reached the booth, I could not find my name,” said Hussain who returned from his booth at Spring Dale High School in Noorkhan Bazaar as he could not find his name on the rolls. “I don’t even recall any political parties campaigning in the past ten days or so,” Hussain added.

Like Hussain, many said that there had indeed been no campaigning which led many to believe that Wednesday was like just any other working day. “I was not even aware that there was an election. It was only when I saw police personnel deployed in our locality did I come to know about it,” said Aleem Khadri, another resident.

Many slammed political parties and said that a lack of development was the reason behind the low turnout.

“There has hardly been any development in our area for years therefore I decided to stay away from polls this time,” said a resident of Panjetan Colony. She said that she also knew about the NOTA option but had decided to give voting a miss regardless. Of the over 50,000 voters in the ward, just 13,000 exercised their franchise. Representatives of political parties were seen trying to urge locals to come out and vote.

Title: Telangana civic polls: Congress, BJP fight for main opposition party tag
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Image used for representational purpose only

HYDERABAD: Much is at stake for Congress and BJP as the poll results on January 25 will decide the fate of these parties on their claim of being the main opposition party to take on TRS. Congress and BJP have already conceded 80 wards, including 77 to TRS and three to AIMIM , without a contest.

BJP entered the fray in 2,313 wards, while Congress in 2,616 wards. Both the parties conceded defeat to TRS in the first round itself by failing to field candidates in over 30% wards of the total wards. As many as 739 wards went to polls without a BJP candidate, while 436 wards had no Congress candidate. With options running out, BJP and Congress leaders blamed the TRS government of ‘managing’ the State Election Commission and giving little time for the opposition parties to finalise the candidates.

Telangana Congress president N Uttam Kumar Reddy exuded confidence of winning a good number of municipalities and municipal corporations and his BJP counterpart K Laxman was equally exuberant, claiming that Wednesday’s polls would prove beyond doubt that his party is the only alternative to the ruling TRS.

Both BJP and Congress members blamed TRS for rampant distribution of money, liquor and gifts to lure the voters. “A free and fair election would see an outright Congress victory,” claimed Uttam.

Title: Thane station may house city’s first ‘oxygen parlour’ with walkways
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

CR intends to place pollution-absorbing plants in a 1,200-sq-ft space at Thane.

THANE: In the first such initiative in the city, health-conscious commuters could soon drop in at Thane station to inhale fresh air as an oxygen parlour is likely to be developed by Central Railways here.

The concept, said officials at Thane station, involves planting certain species of plants known to produce a massive volume of oxygen that will be housed in a specially designed space measuring over 1,200 square feet within the station premises. The stretch will have walkways to enable visitors to move around or stand in the parlour to enjoy the fresh air.

A few plants that are known to absorb harmful pollutants from the air would be identified and shortlisted with help of experts and planted here. Station officials will make arrangements to ensure adequate water supply for plants.

Thane station administration has already shortlisted a few spaces on the station premises where the initiative can be taken up. A request has been sent to the Mumbai division for approval. This initiative could be a step towards combating air pollution in cities, especially around Mumbai division, and if successful, it may be replicated elsewhere, said officials.

When contacted, R Meena, station manager at Thane, confirmed the development and said officials have sought permission from the railway administration and expect a response in a few days.

“The idea is to create a green station within the station premises for commuters to enjoy clean and fresh air. If approved, this could be the first such parlour in Mumbai division. A similar initiative was started by the railways in Nashik recently,” said Shivaji Sutar, chief public relations officer, CR.

While commuters and passengers have welcomed the move, they have raised questions over the space required for the facility. “Thane station is already congested, thanks to bridges and stalls. There is little space for passengers to move. Authorities should look at improving the frequency of trains instead of diverting attention towards other issues,” said a railway activist.

Title: Abdasa MLA’s son uploads videos of firing
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Grab of video showing Jadeja’s son firing in air

Rajkot: Abdasa Congress MLA Pradyumansinh Jadeja’s son has created a flutter on social media after he uploaded three videos on Instagram showing him to be firing in the air from his pistol and a 12 bore gun.

Police said they were checking the videos uploaded by Jaideepsinh Jadeja. “We will check the videos and book Jadeja for the crime, if the firearms seen in the videos are found to be without licence,” said P N Yadav, Nakhatrana deputy superintendent of police.

Meanwhile, Jadeja senior posted a statement on Facebook denouncing his son. He stated: “What Jaideepsinh did was wrong. However, he has licence of the firearms from which he was seen to be firing. The firing took place in our farmhouse.”

Jaideepsinh was even earlier booked in a case related to vandalizing four trucks belonging to a chemical factory.

Title: Dhupkheda residents too want Saibaba temple funds
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Aurangabad: Amid the ongoing row over Saibaba’s birthplace, the time the saint spent in Dhupkheda in Paithan taluka of Aurangabad district and in Beed — before he moved to Shirdi in Ahmednagar — is now in focus.

It is believed Saibaba had briefly stayed in Dhupkheda, which also has a temple in his honour. However, Saibaba’s little-known connection to Beed has come into the limelight for the first time.

Ashok Kamal Pal, who manages the Saibaba Ashram at Dhupkheda, said the saint had stayed at Chandbhai Patil’s house before moving to Shirdi. “Patil was a wealthy village officer. One day, he had lost his mare and was desperately looking for it. But he could not find the mare. It was then that he encountered a fakir. That fakir was Saibaba, who miraculously helped Chandbhai Patil find his mare. Saibaba also performed a few miracles on the occasion, following which Chandbhai Patil requested the saint to visit his home,” Pal said.

Referring to the scriptures on Saibaba, Pal said the saint went to Patil’s house and stayed there for some time. “There was a wedding in Patil’s house and the bride was from Shirdi. So along with the groom’s party, Saibaba reached Shirdi and stayed there for the next 60 years,” he said.

Meanwhile, some people in Beed made a few unfounded claims. They said Saibaba had undertaken a job in one of the shops in the town for a few years. The locals said the British rulers had also taken note of Saibaba’s presence in Beed and had gifted him a pagdi (a traditional headgear).

As the state government has declared funds worth Rs 100 for development of Pathri, a section of devotees has also demanded financial assistance for the development of the Sai temple at Dhupkheda. A group of Shiv Sena functionaries, led by Parbhani MP Sanjay Jadhav, was scheduled to meet chief minister Uddhav Thackeray on Wednesday. The temple trustees and the action committee for Pathri development, however, were not taken along.

Jadhav was said to be in a fix following the stand taken by his party on the row through party mouthpiece ‘Saamna’. In an editorial piece, the mouthpiece had termed the Saibaba birthplace row “uncalled for” and added that the CM can’t be blamed for it. Jadhav could not be reached for his comments.

Title: Tamil Nadu: Rights panel orders government to pay Rs 50,000 to couple harassed by SI
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

TIRUPUR: The state human rights commission (SHRC) has directed to pay Rs 50,000 as compensation to a couple, who was harassed and threatened by a sub-inspector.

V Rajasekar and his wife Thilagavathy are residing at John Jothi Garden in Andipalayam. SI C B Vijaya Mohan , who was then attached to the Tirupur north police station, constructed a house adjacent to the couple’s residence. He had deviated from the plan approved by the city corporation as some windows and staircase touched the compound wall of the couple’s house.

Rajasekar and Thilagavathy objected to the deviation as it was affecting their privacy. But the SI threatened them.

The couple filed a complaint before SHRC in April 2018, stating that the SI was threatening to foist false cases on them and put them behind bars if they continued to question the building violation. “He sent anti-social elements to threaten us. Because of the harassment, tenants were not staying in our house,” the complaint said.

The couple had earlier filed complaints to the collector, city police commissioner and the city corporation regarding the building violation and harassment. They submitted those documents along with CCTV footages before SHRC, which found Mohan guilty.

SHRC member A Chittaranjan Mohandoss said the police officer misused his power and violated the rights of the complainants. The commission recommended state additional chief secretary to pay the compensation.

Title: Crop loan waiver: Maharashtra farmers against mandatory Aadhaar
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Illustration used for representational purpose

AURANGABAD: While the state government has ordered up to Rs 2 lakh crop loan waiver , advocacy groups working for the welfare of farmers have objected to the mandatory requirement of Aadhaar card for availing the benefit.

Highlighting the alleged inordinate delays in Aadhaar enrollment and update, farmer groups have raised apprehensions that the desired benefit might not reach several farmers for the want of Aadhaar card.

Farmers’ leader Jayaji Suryawanshi said it was unjust on part of the government to link the loan-waiver measure with Aadhaar card.

“While no official record of Aadhaar coverage among farmers is available with the government, we every day come across numerous complaints related to difficulties faced by farmers for Aadhaar enrolment and update,” he said.

Civic activist Abhijit Dhanorkar said it does not make much sense to ask farmers to produce Aadhaar card for getting loan waiver.

“Farmers are already getting all the government benefits in form of money directly depositing into their bank accounts. Such accounts are already KYC compliant and can easily ensure that no bogus beneficiary can reap the benefit of government welfare programmes,” he said.

When contacted, some Aadhaar enrollment agencies in the city admitted that the process of new registration for Aadhaar has slowed down in recent past.

Title: Robbers attempt car loot; beat up driver
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Rajkot: Robbers beat up the driver of a car in order to loot his vehicle in Nani Lakhani village of Jamnagar on Tuesday.

Police said the robbers allegedly led by Vishwarajsinh Jadeja beat up Amin Vasa and threw him out of the moving car.

It was Jadeja who called up Piyush Barai, telling him that he wanted to hire a car to go to Ahmedabad. Barai sent the car with Vasa as the driver. On the way, Jadeja and his aides beat up Vasa and threw him out of the moving vehicle.

“Meanwhile Vasa’s father Abdul Vasa received a message that Vasa was found injured at Gulabnagar locality of Jamnagar, following which Abdul called up Barai who approached us. We found the car abandoned near Hapa. The robbers had a change of mind and instead of taking the car along with them, they vandalized it,” said an official from Jamnagar Panchkoshi A division police station.

Title: ‘Will EPS allow OPS to become CM’
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Salem: Pointing out to chief minister’s statement that everybody in AIADMK were CMs and there was no partiality in the party, deputy opposition leader in the assembly Durai Murugan wondered whether Edappadi K Palaniswami would allow his deputy O Panneerselvam to become CM.

Durai Murugan, who is the chairman of the public accounts committee, was in the city on Tuesday to inspect Smart City projects being implemented by the Salem municipal corporation.

Durai Murugan along with other committee members also inspected various government projects being implemented in the district.

On Tuesday, the chief minister said in a public meeting that everyone in AIADMK were CMs and there was no partiality between cadre and leaders in the party.

Durai Murugan met reporters in the district collectorate. He said the committee has power to act against officials who fail to carry out government projects and schemes. “It also has power to send the errant officials to jail and dismiss them from service,” he said.

Title: Abide by apex court’s judgment, oppn tells speaker
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Panaji: The opposition on Wednesday demanded that Goa speaker Rajesh Patnekar take a cue from the Supreme Court’s directives on disqualification petitions pending with speakers of legislative assemblies, and decide on the handful of disqualification petitions pending before him.

MGP, Congress and GFP said Patnekar should decide the fate of the 15 MLAs who switched over to BJP under questionable circumstances and should also send a signal to discourage party-hopping.

“This decision will strengthen democracy. This will stop MLAs from going to one party to the next. The speaker should take up our disqualification petition and dispose it of as quickly as possible,” said lone MGP MLA and former deputy chief minister Ramkrishna Dhavalikar.

In a judgment, the apex court asked the Manipur assembly speaker to decide within four weeks the plea seeking disqualification of BJP lawmaker and Manipur forest minister Th Shyamkumar, who won the election on a Congress ticket only to switch over to the BJP camp.

Immediately after the 2017 state assembly election results, Vishwajit Rane quit Congress. After he switched over to BJP, Mandrem MLA Dayanand Sopte and Shiroda MLA Subhash Shirodkar followed suit by ditching Congress in favour of the saffron camp in October 2018.

Around the same time, two MGP MLAs split from the party and joined BJP without resigning as MLAs. Manohar Ajgaonkar and Deepak Pauskar skirted the anti-defection law as they formed two-thirds of the MGP legislative party.

Congress suffered the same fate in July 2019, when 10 of its MLAs, including opposition leader Chandrakant Kavalekar jumped ship and merged with BJP.

In all these instances, disqualification petitions were filed and these remain pending with the speaker’s office.

“The speaker has failed to even to send notices to the 10 MLAs who have claimed to have merged with BJP. We still maintain that there has been no split in Congress and that the merger is invalid,” state Congress president Girish Chodankar, said.

GFP also agreed with the Supreme Court’s ruling.

“We welcome the apex court’s suggestion that an independent mechanism should decide on disqualifications of lawmakers rather than the speaker. In light of the judgment, the speaker should decide on the pending disqualification petitions immediately. The petitions were filed in May and August of 2019. The speaker should stop acting like a henchman of BJP and decide on the petitions in a non-partisan manner,” GFP president Vijai Sardesai, said.

Title: VMC clears drain after people threaten legal action
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Mangaldeep Society on Old Padra Road

Vadodara: Complaints, representations and memorandums do not seem to be sufficient recourse to those suffering at the hands of the Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC).

A society on the posh Old Padra Road decided to slap a legal notice to the civic body and threatened to file a suit if its drainage line was not cleared at the earliest.

Residents of Mangaldeep Society that has 20 houses had been complaining about blocked drainages to the VMC since November 2019. But when a month passed and things did not move, the owners of houses issued a legal notice to the civic body in December. The move seems to have eventually moved things.

The notice was issued by lawyer Mukesh Thakkar on behalf of the residents. Thakkar himself is a resident of the society and had been trying to get the problem resolved. “The society does not have a registered association or society and there are no formal office bearers. All residents signed the notice that we submitted,” he said.

The notice states that the residents of the society used to pay their taxes regularly. It also pointed out that the right to pollution free water and safe drinking water that were a part of the Right to Life under the Constitution. The society was getting contaminated water due to the blocked sewage line and samples of the water had also been collected by civic officials.

“We issued the notice on December 2, but things did not move even quite some time after this. It was eventually an engineer from ward six who took up the issue and resolved it a couple of days back,” said Thakkar.

Bharat Polra, VMC deputy executive engineer of ward six, said that they had believed that the drainage line passed through the GEB Compound near the society. He said that a RCC road had been laid over the drainage line in the GEB Compound making it inaccessible.

“But later we realised that it had another connection in the nearby Tagore Nagar. The manhole in Tagore Nagar was inside the compound of a private residence. We took the help of a former corporator to ensure that the owner of the house was convinced to remove some flooring for work inside the manhole. The issue has been taken care of now,” he said. Despite the delay, the efforts have left even Thakkar impressed who said that after identifying the fault, Polra was quick to take care of the issue.

Title: Gang of eight held for abducting realtor in Krishnagiri district
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

SALEM: The Salem city police arrested a gang of eight people in connection with for an abduction and ransom case near Hosur in Krishnagiri district on late Tuesday evening. Police are camping in Hosur to nab the gang’s head.

According to city police commissioner T Senthil Kumar, the Kondalampatty police initiated an inquiry after they received a complaint from K Sathyamurthy, 35, a realtor, of Hosur, who was abducted on January 11 by the gang and threatened for ransom.

Sathyamurthy had come to Neikarapatty near Kondalampatty in Salem to see his customer M Karthik, 35. “When Sathyamurthy went to a hotel to have lunch, a gang suddenly abducted him in a car,” the official said. Karthik was also part of the gang, he added.

The gang took the realtor to a hideout in the Gugai area in the city and demanded Rs 1 crore from him for his release. “While he was kept in the hideout for two days, he was severely thrashed by the gang,” the official said.

The gang managed to withdraw Rs 12 lakh using Sathyamurthy’s ATM card. They later released him and warned him not to lodge any police complaint against them.Sathyamurthy, who sustained injuries, got admitted to the government hospital for treatment.

Police came to know about him through hospital authorities. After questioning him, police filed a case on January 14.A special team led by deputy commissioners P Thangadurai (law and order) and S Senthil (crime and traffic) traced the gang near Hosur and made the arrest.

The arrested were brought to Salem on Tuesday nightthe commissioner said. The special team also recovered Rs 10.6 lakh, gold coins weighing two sovereigns and a bike from the gang. The arrested were produced before a magistrate in the district court and were remanded in judical custody. They were later lodged at the Salem central prison.

Title: TN: Finance firm staff held for swindling cash, gold
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: The district crime branch police have arrested branch manager and a gold appraiser of a private finance firm for swindling Rs 16 lakh and more than 1kg gold ornaments from the firm. Two other accused staff members of the company are on the run.

The arrested were identified as S Lakshmi, 35, of Mattanjeir in Palakkad district , and I Biju, 43, of Shoranur in Palakkad. While Lakshmi was the branch manager of Pooram Finserve (P) Limited at Meenakshipuram near Anaimalai in Pollachi, Biju was gold appraiser. Police said Lakshmi was working in the branch since 2018. The company has its head office in Kochi.

During an audit in July 2019, it came to light that staff members of the branch had swindled Rs 16,42,131 in cash and more than 1kg gold ornaments. The report was submitted to the head office, which initiated a probe.

Further inquiry revealed that the branch manager, gold appraiser, assistant branch manager P Subha and public relation officer Vignesh had conspired and forged 25 fake accounts to withdraw cash and gold ornaments.

Area manager of the company L Dhayanandhan lodged a complaint with the district crime branch police, who registered a case. Lakshmi was arrested from Chittoor bus stand, while Biju was held in Kochi on Tuesday.

Title: Social groups to build homes for Kolhapur flood victims
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Kopeshwar temple at Khidrapur submerged in floodwaters (File Photo)

AURANGABAD: Jama’at-e-Islami Hind ( Maharashtra ) in association with Ideal Relief Committee Trust will start building houses for Kolhapur flood victims from January 26.

These social groups signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with Kolhapur Zilla Parishad on January 20 and will build houses by offering financial assistance of Rs 2 lakh per house in addition to the funds received from the flood relief fund and housing schemes of the government. The expected cost of the rehabilitation project is around Rs 2.48 crore.

“Kanwad village in Kolhapur district has been selected for building the houses during the first phase,” an official release issued by Jama’at-e-Islami Hind said.

“In the first phase, houses will be constructed for 38 flood-affected families and two water purifying system will also be made available for drinking water. Shirol taluka of Kolhapur district was the worst affected by the devastating floods and Kanwad and other villages of this taluka were in the grip of flood for considerable time,” the statement added.

Both the aforesaid social groups had conducted an in-depth survey of the Kanwad village and prepared a construction plan for construction of houses.

“If the work of construction under the first phase is completed before monsoon, more houses will be constructed in Kurundwad, Rajapur and Herwad villages in Kolhapur district and Bhilwadi in Sangli district in subsequent phases,” the release said.

In addition, the student organization of Jama’at-e-Islami Hind is slated to provide books to schools and libraries for flood victims once they get rehabilitated.

Volunteers from the disaster management unit of Jama’at-e-Islami Hind had carried out rescue and relief work in some of the flood-affected villages of Kolhapur district.

Kolhapur ZP CEO Aman Mittal and Mohammad Mazher Farooque, Ismail Sheikh and Ashfaque Pathan were present during the signing of the aforesaid MoU.

Title: 600 students take part in Vadodara Hackathon
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Over 433 ideas were proposed against more than 150 problem statements

Vadodara: City-based Parul University (PU) organised a two-day Vadodara Hackathon 2020 on its campus that concluded on Tuesday.

The internal hackathon was a prerequisite of the national-level Smart India Hackathon that will be organized at New Delhi sometime in April-May.

With over 433 ideas proposed against more than 150 problem statements, the hackathon acted as an ideal platform to challenge the technical literacy of the students. These problems were solved by 600 students from diverse academic backgrounds and institutions from across the state.

The event, which aimed at creating a conducive environment on entrepreneurship and innovation for students, was organised in collaboration with Student Startup and Innovation Policy, Gujarat Electronics and Software Industries Association, Federation of Gujarat Industries, MHRD’s Smart India Hackathon, Vadodara Chamber of Commerce & Industries and Vadodara Innovation Council among many others.

“Hackathons are one of the best ways to drive innovation by internally engaging students. It provides a platform for students to collaborate with other business functions and exhibit their creative talent,” said PU’s provost Dr M N Patel.

The themes which the students were focusing on during the hackathon included smart communication, healthcare and biomedical devices, agriculture and rural development, smart vehicles, food processing, clean water and renewable energy.

“Hackathons stimulate the creative intellect of students and they go on to facilitate a problem-solving platform through calculated risk-taking. Having such a diversity of participants in our campus allows for a diversity in perspective and I believe throughout this event we witnessed the fruits of such diversity,” said PU president, Dr Devanshu Patel.

Title: Residents get contaminated drinking water
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Coimbatore: Residents of cooperative B colony in Saibaba colony on Wednesday petitioned deputy city corporation commissioner Prasanna Ramasamy stating they have been receiving contaminated drinking water for the past two months.

D Kalpana, a resident, said storm water drains were filled with sewage water. “Since the drinking water pipelines are passing through the drains, we suspect that the sewage water is getting mixed with drinking water.” She said the water was often brown in colour. “It also has odour.”

The deputy city corporation commissioner received the petition and assured to look into the issue. More than thousand families are residing in the locality. tnn

Title: Talk to Tamil Nadu on sharing Mamallapuram revenue: Madras high court to ASI
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: The Madras high court on Wednesday directed the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) to talk to the Tamil Nadu government to ascertain the possibilities of sharing the Rs 8 crore revenue generated from the Mamallapuram monuments with the local administration for the upkeep and maintenance of the site.

A division bench of Justice Vineet Kothari and Justice R Suresh Kumar passed the order on a suo motu plea initiated to preserve the beauty and safeguard and protect tourists visiting the town.

When the plea came up for hearing, G Karthikeyan, assistant solicitor-general of India, submitted that ASI generated revenue of Rs 8.14 crore from collection of entry fee from tourists visiting the monuments in 2018-19.

“The revenue was Rs 6.65 crore in 2017-18 and Rs 5.98 crore in 2016-17. For 2019-20, we have generated Rs 6.87 crore till December last,” Karthikeyan said.

He pointed out that while ASI is generating income by collecting entry fee from visitors, the local panchayat is also generating income by collecting entry and parking fee from vehicles entering the site.

“ASI is taking care of maintenance of monuments in the site annually and periodically, besides 411 other monuments across the state. The revenue collected is being deposited in the consolidated funds of the Union government and it would not plough back to ASI. Therefore, it is not possible to share any revenue collected from the entry fee,” Karthikeyan said.

Recording the submission, the bench adjourned the hearing to February 25.

Title: Gujarat: Six fishermen rescued after boat catches fire
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

A video grab of the boat on fire

RAJKOT: Six fishermen were rescued from a boat that caught fire in mid sea, off the coast between Porbandar and Harshad of Devbhoomi Dwarka district early on Wednesday morning.

“The fire erupted in Dhanya Jai fishing boat belonging to Wanakbara port of Diu. Another fishing boat, named ‘Saguna’, rushed to the rescue the fishermen in the burning boat and saved seven fishermen on board. However, one fisherman, identified as Avinash Dhania (18), is still missing,” said Shailesh Anjhani, owner of Dhanya Jai boat that caught fire.

The rescued fishermen were identified as Hardik Dari (27), Jainti Vanjha (28), Dilip Dari (31), Devu Handal (59), Pravin Gohel (28) and Bharat Dari (27).

Title: Cancer survivor to ride 3,000 km to spread cheer
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Supriya Goel, 42, will undertake a 3,000-km-long bike ride to give strength to cancer patients.

VISAKHAPATNAM: Little did cancer survivor Supriya Goel who had been physically active since childhood know that she would be diagnosed with cancer in her late thirties.
