JD(S) leader and fomer PM HD Deve Gowda. (File photo)

Title: Accident victims can now hope for timely help
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

The RASTA van will help cops dealt with accidents; (R) The van will be equipped with tools

Vadodara: Victims of serious road accidents in the city will no longer need to wait for rescue teams. The city police have launched a special facility to help such victims get immediate medical treatment. Their initiative — a special RASTA van — will help traffic police tackle accident cases at the earliest.

“In any road accident, an ambulance reaches the spot along with the police vehicle. If the accident is severe where victims are trapped inside the mangled vehicle, we need to act fast to save lives. The tools in RASTA van will come handy in such quick-response rescue operations,” said Anupam Singh Gahlaut, city police commissioner.

The department converted one of its vehicles into the RASTA van with a rescue kit it had received as a donation.

“For vehicles that fall in ditches or on roadside which require to be lifted out, the RASTA van is equipped to do so fitted with ropes, ladder, lights and axe that come handy in such rescue operations. It also has tools to break window panes or breaking open doors. This way we don’t have to wait for the rescue operations by other departments,” Gahlaut told TOI.

The van, which will have a police sub-inspector and two constables, will also have stretcher, a first aid box and other necessary objects to help victims. “With the rise in vehicle density, accidents have become a regular affair. Such a special van is the need of the hour to save as many lives as possible,” a police official said.

In 2019, 148 fatal and 292 grievous accidents took place in the city.

The cops have also been trained to conduct rescue operations and will also start investigating serious accidents like crime scene investigations to ascertain the exact reason.

Every detail of the accident along with the time, reason behind the accident, vehicles involved and exact spot is fed in a special software and the data is then used to make roads safer through effective deployment of traffic cops at key spots.

Title: Police await FSL report, chargesheet in a month
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Jaipur: In Pratap Nagar’s double murder case, the city police have claimed that it will take a month before the chargesheet can be filed against the two accused as the FSL report is still awaited. The two accused are in judicial custody till January 28. The cops claimed to have enough digital and circumstantial evidence against the accused husband, who hired a contract killer to murder his wife and infant child.

Rohit Tiwari hired Saurabh Chaudhary to kill his wife Shweta and son Shreyam. The mother-son duo were murdered on January 7 and both the accused arrested three days later.

Commissioner of Police, Jaipur, Anand Shrivastav talking about the investigation said, “We have sufficient digital evidence against Rohit including phone call and messages between the two accused. We are waiting for the FSL report and the charge-sheet will take at least a month to be prepared. We are covering all aspects in the case so as not leave any loopholes.”

Tiwari, who hails from Delhi, had planned the gruesome killings along with Chaudhary, who was paid an advance of Rs 20,000 to execute the crime. The husband had conspired to kill his wife and son as he wanted to “delete his back history” to get married again. Shweta, who hails from Kanpur, and the infant were bludgeoned to death by the hired killer.

During the questioning it was found that Rohit and Saurabh both had turbulent marital lives which were a common grievance for the two. Saurabh’s pregnant wife was living away from him in Agra due to marital issues and Rohit was also unhappy with his married life. It appears that the two made a pact to kill each other's wives as was found by the cops. While Rohit was sent to judicial custody on January 15, Saurabh was sent to jail two days later.

Title: Maharashtra: Tech glitch hits registration of leave & licence agreements
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Illustration used for representational purpose

PUNE: The state registration department has failed to complete e-registration of over 10,000 leave and licence agreements in the past three days and has blamed the situation on “technical snags” related to non-linking of Aadhaar data with the Unique Identification Authority of India ( UIDAI ) server.

The state has 500 Authorized Service Providers (ASP) for the online registration of leave and licence agreements for properties. However, people from Maharashtra and other states approaching the ASPs for this online registration were made to wait endlessly with the property registration office failing to specify any timeframe to rectify the snag.

An ASP member in Pune said a couple from Rajasthan were forced to stay in a hotel here for the past three days as their registration work was not done because of the server snag. “They had booked their return tickets. But with no sign of their agreement papers getting ready, they are not sure how long they will have to stay back in Pune,” he said.

Another ASP member cited an example of a couple from Hyderabad, who had reached Mumbai to get the registration done and wanted to return the following day. The couple had to cancel their flight tickets because the work was not done.

“It’s a harrowing time for both ASPs and citizens trying to get their leave and licence agreements registered online. Online registration of the documents is not possible when there is no UIDAI server connectivity. Worse, nobody is owning up for the situation. The ASPs have been contacting the Inspector General of Registration’s office and the IT department in Mantralaya but there has been no response,” an ASP member said.

Deputy Inspector General of Registration (IT) P Ahirrao told TOI that the technical glitch was not related to his department. “It’s a problem with the UIDAI. We had sent them a mail on the issue and they replied that they were looking into the issue. We are writing to them daily now. We have to wait for them to rectify the snag,” he said.

An ASP member said, “Such snags are frequent. There should be a nodal officer to coordinate between agencies involved in the registration process and resolve issues at the earliest. Citizens should not be made to suffer.”

From last year, the state government’s department of registration and stamps began allowing registration of residential leave and licence agreements from home through the ASPs. The process requires registration of necessary documents, biometric prints and Aadhaar numbers through the ASPs at their offices or at a citizen’s home. A citizen has to pay Rs1,000 for registration at doorstep and Rs700 if the work is done at an ASP’s office.

The online registration of leave and licence agreements had prompted more people to opt for the formal registration of properties on rent without visiting the sub-registrar’s office. The earlier registration process needed two witnesses.

Title: Capital boost may spur luxury car sales
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

VISAKHAPATNAM: With the Port City assuming the status of executive capital, auto sales in the city are expected to rise in the near future.

Luxury automobile manufacturer Mercedes-Benz opened its flagship store at Mindi , near Gajuwaka on Tuesday, a day after the capital bills were tabled in the Assembly. The German auto company Audi had opened its showroom in the city in 2014.

Martin Schwenk, MD and CEO of Mercedes-Benz India Private Limited, said, “We will keep every model in the city, on par with metros such as New Delhi and Mumbai. Also, we are looking forward to introduce our new electric vehicle in the city once the product is launched after April this year.”

Speaking to TOI, Schwenk said the status of executive capital would be a boon for the luxury automobile market in the city, adding that professionals and realtors would be among the company’s targeted customers.

Managing director of Laxmi Gayatri Hospital, Dr KV Ramkumar, owner of a luxury car, said such cars require maintenance fewer times compared to other cars. “Only once a year do we have to send in a luxury car for service, against every 5,000 km for other cars,” he said.

Speaking to TOI, deputy transport commissioner of the Road Transport Authority (RTA), GC Raja Ratnam said there is an increasing demand for luxury cars and motorbikes in the city, which is expectd to further rise.

RTA sources said that currently, only one triple-digit number for a luxury car is registered in the city, but they expect more such number plates once the executive capital shifts to the city.

Title: Vasantotsav 2020 to kick off from tomorrow
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

VADODARA: The Maharaja Ranjitsinh Gaekwad Institute of Design (MRID) of M S University’s faculty of fine arts is all set to host ‘ Vasantotsav 2020 ’ — a three-day traditional design and craft festival — for the fourth consecutive year.

The craft extravaganza scheduled between January 24 and 26 at the Gulab baug campus of MRID has been providing artisans from across the country a platform to showcase their skills.

“The festival is organised with the vision to bring forth traditional design residing in the villages that have been suppressed by the onslaught of western industrial design. These designs can be India’s answer for a futuristic eco-friendly sustainable design,” said Shatrughan Thakur, assistant director of MRID.

“Artisans from Gujarat, Maharashtra, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Odisha, Chhattisgarh, Rajasthan, Tripura, Assam, West Bengal, Karnataka and Andhra Pradesh have participated and showcased their craft works dealing with leather, puppets, cane, bamboo, ajrak block prints, rogan art, handloom, matani pachedi pottery, handicraft, glass, paper, embroidery in the previous editions of Vasantotsav. They are keen to participate in this year’s event too,” he said.

In the course of Vasantotsav, four craft workshops dedicated for puppet making, glass, terracotta, and block printing will be held for for school students and art enthusiasts too.

Title: ‘Nod sought to swap existing casino vessel with larger ship’
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Panaji: One of the three offshore casino operators has sought permission from the state government to replace an existing vessel with a larger ship, a proposal that the ports department is still considering, said minister for ports Michael Lobo.

“There is a move, we have received an application to replace one casino vessel with another one. It is under consideration,” Lobo said.

Lobo also said that chief minister Pramod Sawant needs to finalise the gaming commission in order to bring transparency to the gambling sector.

“Lot of debates have taken place during the last five-year tenure, and in these three years as well. The gaming commission has to fall in place. I feel that the chief minister should take it up after the budget session,” Lobo said.

The ministeralso said that Goa needs the casino policy to be put in place in order to pave the way for the offshore casinos to be gradually shifted to onshore. Lobo did say that the state government’s first focus is on restarting the mining sector.

“The day mining starts, CM will start thinking about the casino policy. Otherwise people will say that the chief minister is framing policies for casinos and not for mining and mining dependent people. After mining, he will take up this issue which is of importance for tourism also,” said Lobo.

The minister said casino owners suggested that a time-frame should be laid down for offshore casinos to shift to land, but on the condition that live gaming licences are issued, which former chief minister Manohar Parrikar had agreed to.

Title: Pune: Dehu Road Cantonment Board gets MoD nod for land reclassification for school building
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Illustration used for representational purpose

PIMPRI CHINCHWAD: The Dehu Road Cantonment Board (DCB) has got the ministry of defence (MoD) approval for reclassification of land, a first in 60 years, to facilitate construction of a school building.

The need for the school arose after the building housing a school in Shelarwadi, which was started in 1960, was demolished a year ago after its structural audit. “Around 120 students of this school were then shifted to a school in the MB Camp area,” R Haritwal, DCB chief executive officer, said.

“This building was located on ‘A2’ defence land, where any kind of construction is barred,” he said, adding, “The cantonment has also sent a proposal to construct a new school building at an estimated cost of Rs 1.7 crore.”

Title: Save water drive resonates with residents & students
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Jaipur: After an intensive one month awareness campaign on ‘Conserve Water Save Life’, a joint initiative of The Times of India and Water & Sanitation Support Organization of Rajasthan government, an annual calendar 2020 containing 36 paintings was released by Sandeep Verma, principal secretary, Public Health Engineering & Ground Water Departments and Arun Srivastava, director, WSSO, Rajasthan at an event in Hotel Royal Orchid, Tonk Road on Wednesday.

More than 1500 students from Cambridge Court High School, Mansarovar; Maheshwari Girls Public School, Vidyadhar Nagar; Central Academy, Vidyadhar Nagar; St Edmund’s School, Jawahar Nagar; Neerja Modi School, Mansarovar; Maheshwari Public School, Jawahar Nagar; and ICG Institute of Education Research & Development, Mansarovar had participated in the painting competition.

The activities also included the Residential Welfare Associations and Societies where various awareness initiatives were undertaken. Households in the residential societies such as Mahima Panache, Jagatpura; Mahima Panorama, Jagatpura; Ashiana Umang, Ajmer Road; Ashiana Vrinda Gardens, Jagatpura; and Ashiana Rangoli Gardens, Vaishali Nagar were involved in large numbers for demonstrations like clean your vehicles with wet clothes, use RO water for mopping, close the tap when not in use and get leakages repaired at the earliest.

Sandeep Verma, chief guest of the event, said that creating awareness about saving water is the crucial first step and the joint initiative was aimed at achieving that goal. “We are delighted to see people from various walks of life participating in the activities with such great enthusiasm,” said Verma.

Speaking about the government initiatives, Arun Srivastava said that WSSO (Water and Sanitation Support Organization) is responsible for capacity building of officials as well as the nodal agency for implementation of Jal Jeevan Mission, under which the target is to provide piped water to all households. Currently, 12% households in Rajasthan get piped water. “But the target is to provide piped water to all residents by 2024 is our target,” said Srivastava.

The event drew large participation from the schools and the residential societies.

Title: Three IS suspects arrested in Ramanathapuram, one more on the run
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: Continuing the crackdown on suspected Islamic State sympathisers in the wake of the gunning down of sub-inspector Wilson on January 8, the Tamil Nadu police on Wednesday arrested three men, two of them Hindus who converted to Islam, at Devipattinam near Ramanathapuram . A fourth person, who police suspect transferred cash to Wilson’s killers, escaped the police net.

The three arrested, Mohammad Ameer alias Arunkumar, 31, a native of Villupuram, Mohammad Ali alias Manikandan 28, a native of Cuddalore, and Pitchai Kani alias Pura Kani, 45, a native of Keezhakarai , were remanded in prison by a magistrate court at Devipattinam.

Ramanathapuram district superintendent of police R V Varunkumar said, “We had a tip-off about the trio moving from hideout to hideout in the district. Police tracked their movements and apprehended them.”

Investigators say Kani indoctrinated and converted Manikandan and Arunkumar to Islam three or four years ago. Later, police said, they were radicalised by the man who escaped, Shaik Dawood. The National Investigation Agency (NIA) had arrested Dawood in 2018 on charging of converting and radicalising youngsters from poor backgrounds. He came out on bail and went underground and was involved in funding radical elements, police said.

Wednesday’s police operation was led by deputy superintendent of police Velladurai, and special branch sub-inspectors Dhebakar, Senthilkumar and Jesudoss. Officers refused to divulge details of the three suspects activities, which appeared to centred around funding radicals.

As part of the statewide crackdown, the Chennai city police had on Tuesday conducted checks at the lodges and mansions at Periamet and nearby areas. The raids was based on information revealed during the interrogation of Khaja Moideen, main accused in the July 2014 murder of Hindu Munnani leader Suresh Kumar at Ambattur . Moideen had jumped bail along with two other accused, Navas and Abdul Shameem, one of Wilson’s killers. Moideen and Navas were caught along with another man by the Delhi police. In fact, investigators believe it is the news of their arrest on January 8 that enraged Shameem and Toufiq, who killed Wilson later that night.

Title: Research, development & innovation cells to help college teachers seek funds for projects
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

PANAJI: With the University Grants Commission (UGC) stepping back as a major funding agency for research projects by university and college teachers, the state directorate of higher education (DHE) is set to form research, development and innovation cells in all 33 government and aided colleges in Goa. Through these cells, college faculty will be motivated and trained to pursue proposals for funding of their small research projects with central government agencies.

The research cells will help develop and coordinate strategies to maximise the faculty’s success in gaining external research funding.

An umbrella initiative, ‘research, development and innovation cell’, has already been formed in the DHE and is headed by astronomer Vithal Tilvi, who has worked with NASA.

“Though the UGC has stopped funding research in a big way, every central government department has provision for funds for research projects. Most of these funds remain unutilised. College teachers require training on how to effectively write research proposals to be able to bag the funds. The research, development and innovation cell will provide this training and motivation,” a DHE official said.

In each college, a faculty member oriented towards research will be chosen to head the cell. Teachers will subsequently be coached to submit proposals for projects that can be accomplished with financial aid of Rs 5-10 lakh.

“Taking on these projects will help promote the teachers’ personal growth as they will be able to pursue research in varied subjects of their interest. It will also help their careers to progress in terms of promotions, etc. The exposure teachers get will benefit their students as well. It will boost innovation in institutions of higher education,” the official said.

The DHE’s research, development and innovation cell already has 60 teachers involved in writing research proposals.

Title: CM to seek AG’s opinion on Lokayukta report
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Panaji: The state government would seek the advocate general’s opinion before deciding on the Lokayukta’s recommendation to initiate a CBI inquiry against former chief minister Laxmikant Parsekar and two other officials for renewing iron ore mining leases for a second time.

The second renewal of the leases were subsequently quashed by the Supreme Court in February 2018, bringing all mining activity in the state to a grinding halt.

“The Lokayukta report has reached me today, and I have not read it as yet. I will go through it and take the AG’s recommendation,” said chief minister Pramod Sawant.

The Goa Lokayukta Justice P K Misra recommended a CBI inquiry against Parsekar, who is a senior BJP leader in Goa, and two other officials for renewing the mining leases. Misra in his report said that there was enough evidence to suggest that the public functionaries had committed criminal offences.

“It is a recommendatory report which has been sent to the government. It is not compulsory that the government is bound to act,” said Sawant when asked about his stance on the Lokayukta’s recommendations.

He also appeared optimistic of mining activity resuming in the state with a positive outcome expected from the review petition that the Supreme Court is hearing. Sawant said that the Lokayukta’s report would not undermine Goa’s interests in the apex court hearings.

Industries minister Vishwajit Rane said the chief minister has prioritised resumption of mining. “CM is very hopeful that before March 31 we will be able to find some sort of way out,” said Rane.

Title: Rajasthan: Ration card to club with Jan Aadhaar card
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: The state IT department is working on amalgamation of ration card with the Jan Aadhaar card . The ration card is all set to be revised and the state government has decided to introduce smart ration cards in the state.

The state government had already taken a decision to replace the Bhamashah card introduced by the previous BJP government under the direct transfer of benefits with the Jan Aadhaar card. Now government is planning to merge the ration card with the Jan Aadhaar, so it will save money and a single card will serve both the purposes. A single card for all benefits is the idea.

Jan Aadhaar card is meant for the direct transfer of benefits of government schemes to the account of the beneficiary. Officials privy to the development said most of those who are beneficiaries of the PDS and National Food Security Act also come under the same category of beneficiaries.

Besides, both Jan Aadhaar card and ration cards are issued treating each family as the unit. So, there is no point in duplication. “A single card that will cater to all the benefits of government schemes makes sense which would not only reduce the administrative cost but also the investment required,” said an official.

Title: Rajasthan alert on China coronavirus
Content:
An alert has been sounded across the state on novel coronavirus, a virus that has infected over 400 people and... Read More

JAIPUR: An alert has been sounded across the state on novel coronavirus , a virus that has infected over 400 people and caused nine deaths in China. Since many people travel from Jaipur to China for business purposes, the health department has alerted its staff.The state is vulnerable to novel coronavirus as it is a zoonotic disease and the state had reported 16 deaths due to such zoonotic diseases in 2019.In all, 3,111 people had also tested positive for three zoonotic diseases — Scrub Typhus, Crimean-Congo Hemorrhagic Fever (CCHF) and Brucellosis last year.Since, novel coronavirus is also a zoonotic disease, the health department is taking help of the agriculture department to ward off any chances of novel coronavirus entering the state.“We have alerted all chief medical health officers in the state on coronavirus. We have sent them guidelines and information about the disease,” said Dr KK Sharma, director (health), health department.According to the health department, the clinical signs and symptoms of the virus are mainly fever with a few patients having difficulty in breathing.Moreover, the mode of transmission is unclear as of now. The health department officials said so far there is little evidence of significant human-to-human transmission.Besides, World Health Organisation has issued an advice for international travellers stating that while the cause of the pneumonia seems to be a novel coronavirus, transmission potential and modes of transmission remain unclear.Therefore, it would be prudent to reduce the general risk of acute respiratory infections while travelling in or from affected areas (currently Wuhan City).WHO pointed out that travellers with symptoms of acute respiratory infection should practice cough etiquette (maintain distance, cover coughs and sneezes with disposable tissues or clothing, and wash hands).

Title: Finance Minister has lost PM Modi’s faith, must quit: Prithviraj Chavan
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Maharashtra's former chief minister Prithviraj Chavan

PUNE: Former chief minister Prithviraj Chavan on Wednesday demanded the resignation of Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman .

He said the country’s economy was in a poor state, the growth rate has gone down and the IMF's forecast for the country is a worry. “The low GDP reflected the Union government’s failure and Sitharaman should resign as she has lost the confidence of the Prime Minister's Office,” he added.

Addressing a news conference on Wednesday, he said Prime Minister Narendra Modi and home minister Amit Shah are deciding about finance matters.

Pre-Budget meetings are being conducted at the Prime Minister’s Office without Sitharaman and interactions with leading industrialists were carried out in her absence, Chavan said.

Chavan claimed that Modi had conducted 13 pre-Budget meetings and none were attended by Sitharaman.

“Traditionally, the pre-budget meetings are held at the finance ministry under the supervision of the finance minister. But these meetings are held at the PMO office. It may be a testimony of the loss of trust in the finance minister and her style of functioning,” he said.

The former chief minister said he stood by his comment about the Sena wanting a tie-up with the Congrees in 2014.

On the 24x7 night life initiative, Chavan said before implementing the concept in Pune, it should be tested in Mumbai.

Title: Body of businessman’s wife found hanging in Lutyens’ Delhi house
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

NEW DELHI: A 57-year-old woman allegedly committed suicide at her residence in Lutyens’ Delhi on Monday afternoon. The body of Natasha Kapur, the wife of the joint president of Atlas Cycles, was reportedly found hanging from the ceiling fan at her house in Aurangzeb Lane by her family members. Her husband, Sanjay, was not at home at the time.

In a suicide note purportedly written by Kapur, she said that she loved her children and asked them to take care of themselves and Sanjay.

The incident was reported to police around 2.30pm. Kapur’s son, Sidhanth, told police that he had called her several times to ask her to come down to the dining hall for lunch. When she didn’t respond, he went up to her first floor room to check. He found the door partially open and entered. He then went to the bathroom and found her body hanging from the ceiling fan with a piece of cloth. He cut the cloth, brought down the body and carried it to the bedroom.

Sidhanth then informed the other family members and police. Kapur was taken to Sir Ganga Ram Hospital where she was declared dead. The autopsy was conducted at RML Hospital on Wednesday afternoon after which the body was handed over to the family members.

DCP (New Delhi) Eish Singhal said that inquest proceedings have been initiated to find out the reason behind the alleged suicide. A forensic team would be verifying the handwriting and content of the note. It is also being probed whether she suffered from depression.

Police have recovered her mobile phone from which she had sent some messages to a number asking for money transfer the same day. They will question the family members about the phone number and their last conversation with her after the last rites. The cops will also be seeking her medical history.

Title: Force Motors invests Rs 1,000cr on next-gen platform
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Pune: City-based commercial vehicle and engine maker Force Motors has invested Rs 1,000 crore over the last four years to develop a new platform for its next generation of BS-VI commercial as well as electric vehicles.

“The platform has been built to enter more sophisticated markets where the regulations are more stringent... the existing platforms will also continue,” Abhay Firodia, chairman, Force Motors, said.

Prasan Firodia, managing director, Force Motors, said the company’s aspiration was to get significantly into the global markets with this “modular platform” and bring more vehicles on the platform in the future.

The vehicles will be launched on the platform by the end of the year, when the company will reveal the technical specifications and the pricing.

The company said it would target markets in the middle east, Africa, ASEAN and South America, besides India.

Auto slowdown temporary

The current slowdown in the auto sector was temporary and should settle in another three quarters, Abhay Firodia said, adding that the sudden change from the BS-IV to BS-VI regime, lack of financing options due to the NBFC crisis were the main reasons why customer interest was not getting converted into sales.

“I must admit that the government is doing a lot of things right, but it should not be doing business and leave it to industry to do it. For example, they should sell their stakes in the public sector banks and bring that money to help the industry prosper,” he said.

There will obviously be opposition, he said, from the trade unions and others who would try and protect their comfort zone. “But why should the government protect the non-performers,” he asked, while citing the example of Air India.

Title: Telangana leads in artificial insemination of cattle in India
Content:
Image used for representational purpose only

HYDERABAD: As India battles to find a solution to ensure birth of female calves through artificial insemination to fix the skewed sex ratio in cattle, Telangana has surged ahead by topping the charts in the country in using the method for milching animals.While other states are slowly catching up with the method, Telangana is a trailblazer with 2,26,366 calves born under this method. Neighbouring Andhra Pradesh trails far behind (in a distant 10th place) with just 74,667 cattle.Though officials claim it is the way forward, this method using ‘sexed semen’ (sex-sorted semen) technology is mostly used to help in increasing milk production, which is key to farmers’ income as they depend on dairy operations to supplement their farm earnings.The programme, which is meant to cover 1.2 crore cows, was launched by PM Narendra Modi and nearly 17 lakh inseminations have already been done. Unlike the 50:50 chances of male-female calf in normal conventional semen, chances of having a female calf would be close to 80-90% with the use of sex-sorted semen, experts say.Unlike the non-sexed semen which is freely available to farmers, the cost of sexed semen ranges between Rs 700 and Rs 1,200 per dose. The Telangana government has set up a centre in Karimnagar to produce sexed semen.With farmers likely to use three doses to have a female calf, experts pointed out that the high costs could be a spoiler for small and marginal farmers. However, government officials said farmers would get the semen doses at subsidised rates. Apart from Telangana, semen production stations are located in Haryana, Gujarat, Kerala, Madhya Pradesh, Karnataka, Tamil Nadu, Punjab and Uttarakhand. Experts said there is a need for controlled population with high quality genetic potential to be bred at semen production stations. “We need to develop indigenous technology for semen-sexing. We also need to look at disease resistance and feed efficiency in cattle,” an expert said.

Title: Despite gag, MLA Renukacharya continues rant against Muslims
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Mangaluru/Bengaluru: A day after two senior functionaries of the BJP — a deputy chief minister and a political secretary to the chief minister — made provocative speeches against a minority community, Nalin Kumar Kateel , state president of the saffron party, on Wednesday issued a gag order, banning functionaries from talking on issues without the party’s approval.

Deputy CM Govind Karjol and Honnalli legislator MP Renukacharya had passed comments castigating Muslims, in the process seriously denting the image of the party which is trying to avoid controversies in its efforts to allay fears on the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. The comments come on the heels of Ballari City legislator Somashekara Reddy warning Muslims at a pro-CAA rally of repercussions if they do not fall in line.

Kateel told TOI a gag order has been “clearly” communicated to all concerned at a recent meeting that he and chief minister BS Yediyurappa had chaired. “Our message to party functionaries is in line with what Prime Minister Narendra Modi has told his council of ministers and party MPs — to focus on their work and constituencies rather than comment on issues. Let them leave this task to official spokespersons of the party,” Kateel said.

However, it appears the message hasn’t gone through to Renukacharya, Yediyurappa’s political secretary. A day after courting controversy by saying anti-nationals were using mosques to store weapons, Renukacharya said he stood by his comments and launched a fresh tirade against madrasas, saying they were manipulating youth and encouraging terrorism.

Speaking to reporters on Wednesday, Renukacharya said: “In our [temple-run] institutions, nothing anti-national is taught. We only teach values that are mandated for life. But at madrasas, youth are manipulated by teaching terrorism. Why do we need such schools? The majority of those accused of terrorism are Muslims.”

He immediately followed up this comment by saying he did not imply all Muslims were terrorists. The Honnalli MLA justified his comments saying he did not receive a single Muslim vote in the 2018 assembly elections. “They [Muslims] come to us seeking our help. They want the BJP for development, but when it comes to elections, they vote for Congress and JD(S),” Renukacharya said. He said no “special packages” will be distributed to Muslims in his constituency.

Title: POCSO accused escapes from police custody in Haridwar
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

HARIDWAR: An accused, held for his alleged involvement in a kidnapping case, escaped police custody from Haridwar railway station on Wednesday.

The accused, identified as Amit Brahmanand was brought to Dehradun by Mumbai police on remand. He had allegedly abducted a minor girl and brought her to Uttarakhand last year.

Brahmanand was booked under relevant sections of POCSO Act and Section 363 (kidnapping) of IPC. Police say that a hunt has been launched to nab him.

Title: Jaipur Literature Festival begins today, four lakh footfall expected in five days
Content:
The 13th edition of the festival will have a range of speakers including Nobel laureate Abhijit Banerjee and ‘... Read More

JAIPUR: Organisers of Jaipur Literature Festival , which commences on Thursday, said they had allowed fewer registrations this year keeping in mind space crunch at the venue. The five-day event will see more than 200 sessions and will be attended by 250 speakers .Police, too, have suggested allowing fewer registrations compared to previous years to avoid parking woes.The 13th edition of the festival will have a range of speakers including Nobel laureate Abhijit Banerjee and ‘Eat Pray Love’ author Elizabeth Gilbert. Chief minister Ashok Gehlot will inaugurate the festival. The first day session will include speakers such as Nandita Das, Shubha Mudgal, Prasoon Joshi and others. On the inaugural day, there will be 37 sessions.The festival has been marked on the calendars of book lovers and Abhishek Rajpurohit, who was also one of the speakers at JLF last year, said, “The festival provides a platform for literature transcending all boundaries. I have been attending it since many years now and this year as well, plan on attending it for all five days. It is something that I look forward to each year as we get to meet authors who we have been reading since long.” He had taken a session on his research on travels of Moroccan explorer Ibn Batuta in 2019.Prashant Gupta, member of the Jaipur Book Lovers’ Club added, “The festival is something we all look forward to and the club members have discussed the sessions that they would like to attend and Gilbert’s session is the most awaited one.” The organisers are expecting approximately 4,00,000 visitors, which was the footfall in 2019.Cops are also on alert and Anand Shrivastav, commissioner of police, Jaipur told TOI, “We had suggested to the organisers to take fewer registrations this year and all arrangements are in place to ensure that the festival goes on smoothly.”

Title: Sushil Modi, BJP stand by Nitish Kumar under fire from Pavan Varma, Prashant Kishor
Content:
Bihar deputy chief minister Sushil Kumar Modi

नीतीश कुमार जी के साथ यह विडम्बना अक्सर होती है कि अपनी उदारतावश वे जिनको फर्श से उठाकर अर्श पर बैठाते हैं, वे ही उ… https://t.co/bVlOgp58iT — Sushil Kumar Modi (@SushilModi) 1579705398000

भाजपा-जदयू के बीच दो दशक पुराना गठबंधन अटूट है और हमारी सरकार 12 करोड़ बिहारवासियों के विकास के लिए लगातार काम कर र… https://t.co/ue1tahWcHm — Sushil Kumar Modi (@SushilModi) 1579705475000

Being dismissive of citizens’ dissent couldn’t be the sign of strength of any Govt. @amitshah Ji, if you don’t care… https://t.co/bPROa9fGeN — Prashant Kishor (@PrashantKishor) 1579663902000

PATNA: Deputy chief minister Sushil Kumar Modi on Wednesday came out in defence of CM Nitish Kumar , who is currently facing continuous attacks from two senior JD(U) colleagues — national vice-president Prashant Kishor and former parliamentarian Pavan Varma . He described Nitish as a person often exploited by the very people who benefited from his “large-heartedness”.In a tweet, SuMo said, “He (Nitish) gave his chair to someone (a reference to Jitan Ram Manjhi), made many members of Rajya Sabha (Pavan Varma) and lifted many people from non-political corridors and gave them higher position in the organization (Kishor). However, some of those people have not refrained from being ‘thankless’. Not everything is always justified even in politics.”The deputy CM’s observations come a day after Varma wrote a letter to Nitish, expressing his “perplexity” over JD(U)’s decision to form an alliance with BJP for the Delhi assembly election.In another tweet, SuMo said BJP and JD(U) were doing the groundwork to extend their alliance beyond Bihar. “The two-decade alliance between BJP and JD(U) is unbreakable and our government is working together for growth of 12 crore people in Bihar. We are making ground for working together outside Bihar as well and those having ‘excruciating pain’ due to this, are trying to find excuses to break the alliance,” he tweeted.Hours before SuMo’s scathing comments, Kishor, ignoring JD(U)’s steadfast support to the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA), put out a tweet, challenging Union home minister Amit Shah to implement CAA and National Register of Citizens (NRC) in the same “chronology” that he “audaciously announced” to the nation in Lucknow a day earlier.Kishor said, “Being dismissive of citizens’ dissent couldn’t be the sign of strength of any government. @amitshah Ji, if you don’t care for those protesting against #CAA_NRC, why don’t you go ahead and try implementing the CAA & NRC in the chronology that you so audaciously announced to the nation!”His tweet evoked sharp reactions from the state BJP. “Kishor’s comment on Shah is shameful, indecent and intolerable. He has even been making statements against the decisions taken by the top leadership of his own party,” state BJP spokesperson Nikhil Anand said. “Kishor doesn’t have the ability to win a mukhiya or a sarpanch’s election. Even then he seems to regard himself as a leader bigger than CM Nitish Kumar,” Anand added.Many in Bihar political circles claimed Nitish had inducted Kishor into JD (U) in September, 2018, on the “advice” of Shah.JD(U) sources indicated that the party might soon take “disciplinary action” against Kishor and Varma. “Our leadership has initiated the necessary process… Wait till tomorrow (Thursday),” a top JD(U) functionary said, wishing not to be named.

Title: Fair probe into Prakash’s death: Sawant
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Panaji: Chief minister Pramod Sawant on Wednesday said that the investigation into the death of former Merces sarpanch Prakash Naik was under way and would be conducted in a fair manner.

Old Goa police on Sunday had filed an FIR against Wilson Godinho, brother of panchayat minister Mauvin Godinho, for abetment of suicide.

When this was pointed out to the chief minister, he said that the probe would be conducted without “any problems” till the truth emerged.

Title: Cyber crooks strike, dupe and blackmail south Delhi businessman
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

(L-R) Sanchit Saraswat, Mohammad Ali and Deepak

NEW DELHI: Life turned topsy-turvy for a businessman based in south Delhi after crooks not only carried out fraudulent transactions from his credit card, but also sent him objectionable pictures of him and his friend stored on his Google drive.

The accused also blackmailed him with morphed pictures of his family members, asking him to transfer Rs 1 lakh to an anonymous account to not put the pictures online. Three men, including the mastermind, have been arrested using the IP details of the devices of the accused provided by Google.

“The accused are Deepak alias Bittoo (19), Mohammad Ali (19) and Sanchit Saraswat (20). Ali is the mastermind of the gang and has earlier worked in a call centre,” said Atul Kumar Thakur, DCP (South).

Police said that Ali and Deepak were friends. The duo approached their third friend Saraswat who worked as a team leader with a firm. For just Rs 500, Saraswat allegedly provided an excel sheet with confidential data including credit card details, names and mobile numbers of people. The duo procured mobile numbers on fake addresses and started their own ‘call centre’ at Deepak’s house in outer Delhi.

The duo then allegedly started calling people from the list, impersonating executives of their target’s bank. They would gain access to target’s bank accounts and emails using his mobile number and the OTP. “In the current case, the accused ordered a gold chain for Rs 25,000 through an e-commerce website using the businessman’s bank details. The order was frozen as soon as we received the complaint,” DCP Thakur said.

The accused then allegedly accessed the victim’s Google drive and started threatening him with morphed pictures. The businessman was asked to send Rs 1 lakh to not leak the pictures.

Title: Jaipur: One held for duping man of Rs 3 lakh
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: City police on Wednesday arrested a person who had robbed a resident of Shyam Nagar of Rs 3 lakh on the pretext of giving him dollars at reduced rate in return.

According to the complaint, Mukesh Kumar Yadav ( 30) was standing on Sikar Road on January 12 when he was approached by a man who claimed that he was looking for work and was willing to be employed as help.

DCP South, Yogesh Dadhich said, “The complainant called the man to his office the next day. The person came with the accused.”

The accused, identified as Rafiq Shaikh, 24, told Yadav that his aunt had $1,600 which he wanted to exchange for Indian currency. “On January 16, the accused called the complainant to his aunt’s place in Gujjar ki Thadi. When Yadav and his wife reached the location, two persons got into their vehicle and asked them to drive to a lane. The complainant said the accused made them sniff something after which they fell unconscious. When they regained consciousness, they found Rs 3 lakh and a laptop missing,” the official said.

Title: To decongest KIA, govt moots new airport in Tumakuru or Kolar
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

KIA airport

BENGALURU: In a bid to “decongest” air traffic in Bengaluru, the government has proposed to construct a greenfield airport in either Tumakuru or Kolar. With the chances of HAL airport, in the heart of the city, opening up to civil aviation looking “bleak”, the government is scouting for alternatives that are relatively close to Bengaluru.

Planning commission vice-chairman BJ Puttaswamy told reporters on Wednesday the infrastructure development department (IDD) has pencilled in Kolar and Tumakuru districts for the new airport.

“We had a meeting with officials of the department and efforts are being made to identify a location for the purpose. This is to circumvent possible saturation of air traffic in Bengaluru in the coming years,” Puttaswamy said.

Confirming the proposal, IDD officials said the whole process will take at least 10 years as identification of a suitable location and construction of a full-fledged airport “cannot be done overnight”.

“The intention is to create an alternative to the already burgeoning Kempegowda International Airport. But the process is a long-drawn affair and will take at least 10 years by which time the concessionaire agreement with BIAL will almost be at an end,” an official said.

Puttaswamy said the possibility of Kolar hosting the new airport is “slightly less” as it would be more beneficial to neighbouring Andhra Pradesh than Karnataka. IDD officials say Kolar does have a ready-made infrastructure with a World War II era airstrip which is currently being used by the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) for test flights. But an official admitted, “With the airstrip under the control of the MoD, it is difficult to construct a civilian airport in the district.”

Puttaswamy said the government plans to have 10 airports in the state — one for every three districts. He said new airports could come up in Gadag, Koppal, Kodagu and Chikkamagaluru districts.

Title: Orissa high court ire at delay in Cuttack sewerage work
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

CUTTACK: The Orissa high court has expressed strong dissatisfaction at “no such visible progress” even after seven years in the Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA)-funded drainage and sewerage project in Cuttack city. Odisha Water Supply & Sewerage Board (OWSSB) is implementing the Rs 810.83 crore mega project to build a comprehensive sewerage system for collection and disposal of waste water.

The court has issued notice to the chief engineer, OWSSB and project director JICA (Cuttack) to file an affidavit on the detailed status report on the project’s progress by February 3.

The court also reprimanded the JICA project authorities for the tardy progress in spite of the assurance given by them “from time to time to the state administration to complete the project work at the earliest”. Chief minister Naveen Patnaik had laid the foundation stone of the JICA project in October 2012 with July 2016 as the deadline for its completion. It was later rescheduled to September 2018.

The HC sought three separate status reports from JICA project authorities — “wards/areas of Cuttack city where the project work has been completed, where it is partly completed and what time will it take to complete the work in those specific areas and in which wards/areas work has not commenced at all”.

“The affidavit has to further indicate what precautionary measures the authorities have taken for smooth passage of pedestrian on roads where the work is in progress as well as for preventing any kind of accident at the construction site,” the division bench of Acting Chief Justice Sanju Panda and Justice S K Sahoo said in its December 20 order, a full text of which was available on Wednesday.

The bench issued the order on “a suo motu writ petition” registered by the high court in the form of a PIL “taking into account newspaper reports relating to a lot of inconvenience faced by the public in general” on account of the JICA drainage and sewerage projects in Cuttack city.

The project envisages a sewage system with an underground sewer line of 385 km long with 36 pumping stations and three sewage treatment plants.

Title: Odisha govt eyes March 1 start to SCB expansion work
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

5T secretary V K Pandian and works secretary Dr Krishan Kumar during their visit to SCB Medical College and Ho... Read More

BHUBANESWAR: The state government will start land acquisition for the proposed expansion plan of SCB Medical College and Hospital, Cuttack — at an estimated investment of Rs 1,000 crore — on Thursday after chief minister Naveen Patnaik reviews it, government’s media adviser Manas Mangaraj said here on Wednesday.

After 5T secretary V K Pandian visited the hospital early on Wednesday morning as a precursor to the CM’s visit there a day later, Mangaraj said the government has set a target to complete the acquisition of 25 acre by February 28. “The work will commence on March 1 ,” he said.

The government is planning separate vertical structures dividing the institution into four major zones distinct from each other for patient care, college, doctors’ accommodation and students’ hostels. Naveen is likely to unveil the plan during his visit to SCB on Thursday, sources said.

The government’s media adviser said some patches of land currently under departments of water resources, higher education, technical education will be transferred to the hospital. Similarly, some quarters currently occupied by Class IV employees and government accommodation given to 13 doctors will be removed to create space for the expansion. “While those being removed from government quarters will be given alternate accommodation, the government will announce a suitable compensation package for private individuals affected by the drive,” he said.

To ensure better connectivity to the hospital, the government will widen the road alongside Taladanda canal connecting the hospital to three lanes, he added.

Earlier, Naveen in November last year announced Rs 1,000-crore package for SCB Medical College and Hospital, Cuttack, promising world-class facility at affordable prices. He has announced to increase the bed strength to 3000 from the current 2100 and set a benchmark AIIMS plus (better than AIIMS) for the expanded facility.

Established in 1944 as Orissa Medical College , the SCB (renamed in 1951) with 250 MBBS has daily average footfall of more than 8000 patients. In a parallel move to infra boost, the government is also planning administrative restructuring of the hospital on the lines of AIIMS.

Title: State makes cardiac care more accessible
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Panaji: The directorate of health services on Wednesday signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with Healthway Hospital, Old Goa to partner under the STEMI-Goa project as a Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI) to provide required treatment.

Under this programme, patients can be diagnosed at any of the 12 peripheral government primary or community health centres which act as smaller hubs. These include Valpoi, Mapusa, Chicalim, Canacona, Curchorem, Ponda, Margao, Sankhali, Dharbandora, Pernem, Panaji and Aldona.

After diagnosis is done using Tele-ECG, a patient is thrombolysed at one of the 12 primary centres in the vicinity of the patient’s location and then shifted through a cardiac ambulance either to Goa Medical College (GMC) and hospital, or any hospital that has signed an MoU under this programme with the government, for further management.

Patients referred from the North Goa health hubs can now avail treatment at Healthway Hospital under DDSSY insurance scheme.

The project was initiated by health minister Vishwajit Rane and developed under technical guidance of Dr Guruprasad Naik, head of department of cardiology, GMC to reduce increasing mortality from heart attacks.

Title: Rajasthan government rolls back order on T-shirts, jeans on campus
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: The state government on Wednesday rolled back the order banning T-shirts and jeans for teachers and employees at government schools in Tonk district.

School education minister Govind Singh Dotasra on Wednesday tweeted, “Orders of banning jeans and t-shirt for teachers in Tonk district have been rejected.

The chief district education officer who has issued such orders without the permission of higher authorities has been issued show-cause notice.”

It may be noted that an order was issued on Tuesday banning T-shirts and jeans for teachers and employees.

Chief district education officer (Tonk) Shivram Singh Yadav on Tuesday said, “These dresses violate the decorum of the school.

They don’t look good in work places. These are indecent and informal dresses. Employees must wear formal wear which will set an example for the students as well,” said Yadav.

Title: Muslim outfits to strengthen stir against Citizenship Act
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Kozhikode: Expressing dissatisfaction over the Supreme Court ’s decision on the Citizenship (Amendment) Act ( CAA ), Muslim organizations have called for the strengthening of the agitations against the law.

IUML state general secretary KPA Majeed said that though it was a positive step that the Supreme Court was ready to hear the case in detail, the party would strengthen the agitations. The party will continue its fight against the law without any compromise, Majeed said in a statement.

Sunni leader Kanthapuram A P Aboobacker Musaliyar said it is known that almost 75% of the people in the country are against CAA. “I wonder why a decision in the case was postponed. All concerned should jointly continue peaceful protests,” he said in a statement.

Kerala Nadvathul Mujahideen (KNM) state president T P Abdulla Koya Madani and general secretary Muhammad Madani said that the agitations against CAA should continue. They said the hope of secular democratic forces is the Supreme Court. “The agitations should continue till CAA and NRC are completely withdrawn,” they said.

Jama’at-e-Islami Kerala Amir M I Abdul Azeez called for extending and strengthening of the agitation. Same kind of experience from the apex court in important issues will adversely affect people’s faith in the judiciary, he said, adding that the court could have stayed the implementation of CAA in view of the explosive situation in the country.

Popular Front of India (PFI) leaders told a news conference that the organization would continue the legal fight and protest in the streets in the coming days. Addressing a news conference, PFI national vice-chairman OMA Salam said that it was a fight for the continuance of India as a secular and democratic country.

Students Islamic Organisation (SIO) said that the court did not consider the nationwide agitations while considering the case. The court considered it as an ordinary issue though more than 30 people have lost their lives. The agitation against the CAA should be continued with more coordination, SIO said.

Title: 6kg manja collected
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

The deadly nylon manja was illicitly sold on a large scale in the city this year

Nagpur: Despite the ban and administrative action , the deadly nylon manja was sold on a large scale in the city this year. A group of local NGOs collected around 6 kilograms of nylon manja from different areas.

To save citizens, animals and birds from the menace of nylon manja, members of Growill Foundation, Bakula Foundation, Matrix Warriors, REEF, CAG, I-Clean Nagpur, Yashodhara, Save Bharat Van Team and others came under the aegis of ‘Angry Birds of Nagpur’ and collected over 20 bags of the banned manja in just 12 hours.

Ten teams consisting of around 200 people conducted the activity simultaneously at 11 sites in the city. The manja was collected from Bharat Van, Empress Van, Sonegaon, Vasantrao Naik Basti, Bajaria, Takia Basti, Khamla, Reshimbagh and Pardi slums.

Title: Govt can’t invalidate PAN for lack of Aadhaar linkage: Gujarat high court
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: The Gujarat high court said that a person’s Income Tax (I-T) permanent account number ( PAN ) does not become invalid for filing income tax returns and making transactions just because it is not linked to their Aadhaar card.

The HC said the government cannot make a PAN inoperative or hold the PAN holder to be a defaulter just because their PAN was not linked to their Aadhaar or their Aadhaar number was not quoted till the Supreme Court decides the validity of the Aadhaar Act, which is pending in the form of a reference before a larger bench.

The HC made it clear that until the apex court decides the issue of the Aadhaar Act’s validity as a money bill in Rojer Mathew v/s South Indian Bank Ltd, the government cannot take action against PAN holders for not linking them with their Aadhaar ID, under Section 139AA of the Income Tax Act.

The HC recently passed this order on a petition filed by advocate Bandish Soparkar in 2017, when the central government had issued the diktat mandating linking of PAN with Aadhaar. On March 31, 2019, the central government set a deadline of September 30 for this.

Soparkar submitted before the HC that parting with biometric data by linking his PAN with Aadhaar would cause irreparable damage to him. If his PAN was suspended for not linking it with Aadhaar, he would not be able to operate his account. Since the reference before the SC will have direct impact on the issue, his petition also cannot be decided till the SC decides the reference.

Read this story in Bengali

Title: Nilesh Cabral: Tender for new Saligao power substation next month
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Photo used for representational purpose only

SALIGAO: Power issues in Saligao constituency may be a thing of the past, as the electricity department will float a tender next month to set up a substation in Saligao.

Instead of poles, the substation will have big towers, power minister Nilesh Cabral told a gathering at the Saligao panchayat hall after unveiling a plaque to mark the commencement of work to convert the overhead 11KV feeders to underground system, erection of new DTCs, augmentation of DTCs, erection of additional feeders conversion of single phase to three phase lines, replacement of conductors providing guarding DP and renovation and replacement of FRP box with MS distribution box.

The project cost will be around Rs 13.7 crore and the tender will be floated next month, he said on Wednesday.

“Towers will be placed at every 100m to 800m to get power supply for the substation,” the minister said.

“While erecting the towers, there should be no objections from the villagers and everyone has to stand united in supporting a good cause,” he said.

“The entire power department, including the chief engineer and executive engineer, are working tirelessly to ensure that 24-hour power supply is given to the constituency. But we need people’s cooperation in taking this forward,” Cabral said.

Thanking the minister for the project, Saligao MLA Jayesh Salgaonkar said the substation will resolve the major problem of load-shedding that the people of the area had to bear with.

Title: Abandoned for lack of stomach wall, Ahmedabad girl gets new lease of life
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: A farmer in Kuvana village in Banaskantha district found a newly-born girl on January 9. The girl was in pain and was crying profusely - her intestines were out of her body and there was imminent danger of contacting infection. She was first taken to a community health centre (CHC) nearby and then was sent to Civil Hospital in Ahmedabad in hope to save her life.

Hospital authorities said that it’s very likely that the child probably got abandoned by the biological parents due to the congenital condition.

Dr Rakesh Joshi, head of paediatric surgery department at Civil Hospital, said that the girl had a birth defect known as gastroschisis where abdominal wall is not fully developed and thus the intestines get spilled out of the abdominal cavity. “The girl weighed 2.3 kg and her other vitals were normal - prompting us to take her to neonatal intensive care unit and then to operation table. The operation was performed almost immediately at 11 pm on January 9 itself,” he said.

The operation was successful and the girl started feeding. As on January 22, she weighs 2.8 kg and has been handed over to city-based Shishu Gruh, said Civil Hospital officials.

Dr GH Rathod, medical superintendent, Civil Hospital, said that the congenital anomaly has prevalence of about 4 per 1000 live births. “Immediate surgery is required so that the exposed intestines don’t get swollen up and the child doesn’t contact fatal sepsis (infection),” he said.

Dr Joshi said that survival rate of such children is very low. “At Civil Hospital, only three such babies have survived in last 10 years primarily due to infections contacted by the child in open environments. In this case, the child was found soon after abandonment and was relatively free of such conditions. The child care agency has been advised to undergo regular check-ups for next few months,” he said.

Title: Gehlot largesse for Raje, does about turn on perks
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Jaipur: The Congress that had strongly opposed a legislation of the then Raje government allowing former chief ministers to have lifetime bungalow seems to have taken a somersault now.

The Rajasthan Ministers’ Salaries Amendment Act 2017 also allowed them to retain staff and allowances equivalent to a cabinet minister.

Sources said after being snubbed by the Supreme Court, the Gehlot government is now planning to make a policy on house allotment to MLAs so that former chief minister Vasundhara Raje, being an MLA, could continue to occupy the same bungalow — 13, Civil Lines. Before the legislation, former chief ministers were allotted just bungalows in the state, but through administrative orders. Raje brought in the legislation after similar orders in Uttar Pradesh were struck down by the Supreme Court.

After the Rajasthan high court struck down the previous Raje-government’s legislation in September last year, the present Ashok Gehlot government went an extra mile and approached the Supreme Court through a special leave petition (SLP) challenging the high court order.

It is well known that both Gehlot and Raje, despite being on opposite sides of the political spectrum, enjoy a mutually ‘beneficial’ rapport.

The argument of the state government in the court in favour of the legislation was that it was essential to protect the dignity of former chief ministers.

The Congress had initially alleged that the legislation was being brought in to specially favour Raje to retain the Civil Lines bungalow for lifetime, which she renovated spending huge sums from the state exchequer though there already existed an official CM residence at 8, Civil Lines. All the CMs before Raje had lived in 8, Civil Lines. After becoming CM for the third time in 2018, Gehlot also moved to 8, Civil Lines.

Under the provisions of the 2017 Act, only former chief ministers who served full terms of five years were eligible for the bonanza. Accordingly, Raje and Gehlot are the only two leaders at present who were eligible for the largesse under this Act.

Ghan Shyam Tiwari, a former BJP leader and a strong critic of Raje now in the Congress said, “the government should comply with the apex court order.” Tiwari had launched a campaign against the legislation.

Raje was allotted 13 Civil lines bungalow after she lost power to Gehot in the 2008 assembly polls. In 2013, Raje returned to the chief minister’s post, but did not shift to the official CM residence at 8, Civil Lines. After she lost power in 2018, days before the new government took over the same bungalow was allotted to her.

A PIL was filed in the high court challenging the Rajasthan Ministers’ Salaries Amendment Act 2017 in the light of the Supreme Court ruling and the high court declared the legislation illegal.

Title: Rajasthan: Anti-CAA stirs intensify ahead of Republic Day functions
Content:
This story is from January 23, 2020

Chief minister Ashok Gehlot and deputy CM Sachin Pilot during a meeting at Youth Congress office in the city o... Read More

JAIPUR: With Republic Day approaching, anti-CAA protests in the state have gained momentum.

The Bhim Kranti Sena is holding a protest march from Gandhi Circle to Raj Bhawan on January 24. Muslim women in Tonk have started another Shaheen Bagh with 24x7 protests. Along with civil society groups in Jaipur, Ajmer, Kota and Sikar will hoist the national flag on the intervening night of January 25-26.

Political activist Mohsin Rasheed plans to write the Preamble with blood of people of all faiths to mark Republic Day.

“Our Republic Day has never so meaningful as it is going to be this year. People from all faiths and communities will donate blood and will use it to write the Preamble to represent the ethos of the country,” said Rasheed. Tonk has started holding protests daily from 10am to 6pm to express their solidarity with like-minded people.

Barely 150 km from Tonk is Kota, which is also witnessing a round-the-clock sit-in near the house of Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla. “We have plan to hoist the flag on January 26 midnight at the protest site followed by patriotic songs. The message is clear. We want to reclaim the Constitution from the hands of the fascists who are unfortunately at the helms of affairs,” said Shifa Khalid, a mother of three children. Khalid has been holding 24/7 sit-in at Kota since January 14.

Samvidhan Bachao Andolon, a non-registered group started by Mohammad Alimuddin in Ajmerm, will hold a rally with madarsa children in Dargah Bazaar holding the Tricolour. “It is no longer a protest for us. It is become a movement for us to know our rights and duties. We have invited Constitution experts who will address the people on universal human rights and our Constitution,” said Alimuddin.
